excerpts: I ordered the grilled veggie burrito on a whole wheat tortilla with pinto beans, sliced avocado and a big handful of jalapenos.
jalapenos.author: Jessica T.
jalapenos.review:
Starving from walking around all day - we hungrily descended upon El Beach Burrito.

I ordered the grilled veggie burrito on a whole wheat tortilla with pinto beans, sliced avocado and a big handful of jalapenos. 

The burrito was gigantic, and overflowing with flavorful ingredients. El Beach Burrito is far from being a Papalote, but I found my burrito to be filling, tasty, and the service friendly.

I smothered my burrito baby with red and green sauce and promptly left an empty plate.

Trust.

excerpts: Theres a sauce bar with salsas and jalapenos.
I would come back if in the area again.
jalapenos.author: Marissa C.
jalapenos.review:
We wanted acai bowls at the store next door, when they ran out of acai we decided to leave to find food elsewhere and decided to give this place a try. 

I got the super burrito with spicy chicken and my boyfriend got the quesadilla with carnitas. Both were a lot better than we thought! Theres a sauce bar with salsas and jalapenos. I would come back if in the area again.

excerpts: I am mainly vegetarian but occasionally eat fish, and this place has OPTIONS!:  a veggie burrito, a grilled vegetables burrito,
a beans and rice burrito, a tofu burrito, a fish burrito, a prawn burrito, and my favorite, the chile relleno burrito.
grilled vegetables.author: Alison Y.
grilled vegetables.review:
Okay, let's just start off by stating the obvious: no, this is not a place in the Mission. However, it is one of a very few Mexican places in the outer sunset, and I have found that El Beach Burrito far outshines their neighborhood competition.

1. Lots of choices, especially if you don't eat very many meat products. I am mainly vegetarian but occasionally eat fish, and this place has OPTIONS!:  a veggie burrito, a grilled vegetables burrito, a beans and rice burrito, a tofu burrito, a fish burrito, a prawn burrito, and my favorite, the chile relleno burrito.

2. Decent size and not horribly expensive. Yes, you pay $1.50 more for a 'super' burrito, but even the regular burritos are large. Plus they give you a decent amount of chips and you can take as much salsa as you'd like from their salsa bar.

3. Friendly staff. The two guys who run the cash register have always been super nice and happy. Even the cook staff has always been smiling when I'm in there.

Those three things alone make this a far preferable option (in my opinion) than La Playa on Noriega. Plus I like the flavors of their burritos far more as well.

excerpts: Excellent food, the chile relleno burrito is killer.
Generous portions and the salsa is made fresh every day.
The staff is friendly and it's the kind of neighborhood business I love to support.
This place is great and Jason is
a good guy - so are Juan Carlos, Jose and Suzanno.
chile relleno.author: Michael S.
chile relleno.review:
Excellent food, the chile relleno burrito is killer.  Generous portions and the salsa is made fresh every day.  The staff is friendly and it's the kind of neighborhood business I love to support.  
This place is great and Jason is a good guy - so are Juan Carlos, Jose and Suzanno.

excerpts: The horchata and cantaloupe agua fresca was really good too.
I got the horchata, but I do wish that I got the cantaloupe instead.
agua fresca.author: Nina Y.
agua fresca.review:
This place is really average. 

I ordered a super meat burrito with chicken asado (chicken, beans, rice, salsa, guac, and cheese). The guac is nice and they do add a lot of it in it. The chicken was pretty good as well. They do have some chips, but really, they are stale. 

The horchata and cantaloupe agua fresca was really good too. I got the horchata, but I do wish that I got the cantaloupe instead. It was good!

Pretty good food. Not amazing.

excerpts: Pretty cheap (except for the non-American sodas, which were apparently $3.00 or I was totally ripped off).
I thought the staff was very nice and my tacos took about 2 minutes (rice & beans + cheese).
A few more chips would have been nice but whatever.
The bathroom is clean and colorful like the restaurant.
sodas.author: charlotte c.
sodas.review: Pretty cheap (except for the non-American sodas, which were apparently $3.00 or I was totally ripped off). I thought the staff was very nice and my tacos took about 2 minutes (rice & beans + cheese). A few more chips would have been nice but whatever. The bathroom is clean and colorful like the restaurant.

excerpts: I open them up and they're literally corn tortilla + a bit of meat
tortilla.author: Allison O.
tortilla.review:
The people are terrible, and the food is terrible.

There is no menu when I walk in. The lady is extremely rude in asking what I want so I ask if they have tacos. She communicates this to the high af cook who throws two tiny corn tortillas on the grill. They start talking in Spanish and I catch a few words including "cochina". Google it.

I stand there awkwardly until they're done then go to pay, and she gives no instructions on where to put my card or a price. Turns out to be over $10 for these two tiny "tacos". I open them up and they're literally corn tortilla + a bit of meat + some chopped tomatoes.

Will not be going back here.

excerpts: I ordered a beach bowl, which is essentially all the fix-ins of a burrito without the tortilla.
tortilla.author: James D.
tortilla.review:
Came here just because I was craving Mexican food. I ordered a beach bowl, which is essentially all the fix-ins of a burrito without the tortilla. 

The food was ok at best, further the price was a little high (I paid $11 for my order).

excerpts: My meal was so sadly flavorless, the food was crying, and the only thing to mop its tears were the thin layer of tortilla chips.
I tried so hard to comfort my sad meal, my natural solution was to ask for more more chips!
(Chips are usually free for dine-in Mexican places any how, right?
Besides they're at the counter, with tongs, and bags, within arms reach of the customer).
So I go inside for more chips and FMcF immediately snaps at me
THEY'RE NOT FREE".
tortilla.author: Arielle C.
tortilla.review:
El Beach Burrito? How about El B*tch Burrito. I would give this place ZERO STARS if possible. Between the restaurant layout, the food, and especially the service, this IS ABSOLUTELY the WORST dining experience I have ever had...

1. Didn't know where to order or pay
The only indicator of where this restaurant's overhead menu is is Frowny McFrownster (FMcF) half waving at the confused would-be (but shouldn't-be) customers. (Is she saying 'hi' to me? Is she telling me to go away? Oh, she's telling me the menu is in the way back where she's standing!) Even then, the menu was shrouded behind cooking vents in the furthest corner of the restaurant, and had more pages than there were TV screens - a perfect example of where technology does more harm than good. (Wait... still can't find the menu. Oh! There it is! I think I want the burrito, no, the nachos, no the tacos, wait... what were my options again? I guess I'll wait for the slide show to start again...)

2. Soggy flavorless food
I ordered the nachos, because you can never mess up nachos, right?! WRONG. There were not enough (stale Costco) chips. There was but one layer of sad (not toasted) chips, struggling under the weight of the watery beans and chicken (and NO CHEESE). 
My meal was so sadly flavorless, the food was crying, and the only thing to mop its tears were the thin layer of tortilla chips. 
I tried so hard to comfort my sad meal, my natural solution was to ask for more more chips! (Chips are usually free for dine-in Mexican places any how, right? Besides they're at the counter, with tongs, and bags, within arms reach of the customer). So I go inside for more chips and FMcF immediately snaps at me "THEY'RE NOT FREE". So I give my eye-rolling server the $1.10 for the small bag of chips, which contained just as many chips as my original $12 plate of sorrowful nachos did.

3. Found hair in my food - correction: HAIRS
My boyfriend says I have a special talent for finding hairs in my food. I think he's a little embarrassed at how often I complain about it. Well... today was one of those days. Once I sat down with the new bag of chips, I dipped into my nachos and... pulled a hair out! It was buried quite deep, but was short and blonde. (FMcF had long black hair. Let's give FMcF the benefit of the doubt and not make this dining experience any worse.) So I picked out the hair and tossed the contaminated bite to the dog. When I finally mustered the strength for a second bite... I found a SECOND HAIR. A SECOND HAIR BURIED EVEN DEEPER THAN THE FIRST.  I presented my furry dish to FMcF, expressing my distaste.  She initially refused to believe me, insisting she didn't see it. Then she offered "MAYBE IT WAS ON THE FORK". I showed her the hair was buried, I insisted this was the second one I found in my dish, and get this, FMcF said "YEAH I GET IT. YOU'RE TRYING TO COMPLAIN.. WHAT DO YOU WANT ME TO DO... REMAKE IT?" First of all, the hair was definitely embedded in the food. Second of all, why would hair growing on your forks be any better? Hair should not be floating around (or be buried) in the food you serve. 

In the end, I was too upset to wait for them to remake my nachos, especially after being asked detailed questions about what I ordered (sorry, not sorry, but I was upset enough as it was and FMcF could have safely deduced my order by looking at my untouched plate). I walked away. My only regret is not asking for a refund first. Actually, my regret is not taking a hint from the lack of traffic and making the mistake of walking into El B*tch Burrito at all!

IN CONCLUSION. Do not mistake this places's cleanliness for godliness. The fact this place LOOKS clean is because there's no mess to pick up! People aren't going here because they don't want  Mexican food by the beach. They aren't coming here because no one likes Mexican food that tastes more flavorless than the cafeteria lady's leftover surprise. But hey, at least the cafeteria lady wears a hairnet.

excerpts: There was nothing Mexican about the entire flavor except for the fact that it was served on a piece of corn tortilla topped with slightly salted beans and tomatoes that seemed to have been treated to resemble salsa.
tortilla.author: Shinta L.
tortilla.review: The worst mexican food I have ever had. Overpriced too. I ordered fish taco and shrimp taco. It was bland. The fish was just seasoned with salt and pepper (andddd under-seasoned). Not even a drop of spice unique to mexican food was there. There was nothing Mexican about the entire flavor except for the fact that it was served on a piece of corn tortilla topped with slightly salted beans and tomatoes that seemed to have been treated to resemble salsa. Shrimp taco is same treatment. Let's move to the homemade salsa bar. WORST salsas ever. No flavor, lack or no seasonings. The entire meal was a waste of money.

excerpts: Another variable is the tortilla chips:
tortilla.author: CJ G.
tortilla.review:
While not a rival to the best of the Mission, El Beach Burrito provides reasonably good Mexican fare in the Sunset.

A friendly and casual place, El Beach Burrito is not trying to be creative, just to put out some solid Mexican at a reasonable price.  The sizeable super veggie nachos feature sautéed zucchini, squash, onions, and bell peppers and pack a nice, spicy punch.  What the burritos lack in flavor they make up for in size.  The chicken burrito is good, but lacking in the intense flavors that a true Mission-style burrito would deliver.  Another variable is the tortilla chips:  they vary from good and fresh to tasting like they came from Costco.

Depending on when you go, the service can be friendly or spaced out.

If you are in the Sunset with a craving for Mexican, El Beach Burrito will do; if you are looking for high quality burritos or tacos, hop on Muni and get over to the Mission.

tortilla.review: I love this place so much. The staff is great and they have memorized my order. I get the chorizo breakfast burrito with tofu instead of meat on a sun dried tomato tortilla and it is the most delicious burrito I have ever had. The tofu is always perfect and the burrito is huge- easily worth the cost. This place is very accessible for vegetarian and vegan diets and is easily one of my favorite spots in the sunset!

excerpts: So you can imagine, that when I got my very well priced slab featuring a wheat tortilla absolutely jammed with grilled tofu, black beans and mild sauce I went to town.
tortilla.author: Jason B.
tortilla.review:
An epic show. An epic run. An epic burrito.

I'm pretty sure I know why this burrito was so good. I had just finished two epic nights with Above & Beyond in Los Angeles. And had flown home right after the second show to run Bay To Breakers.

I was slightly hungry. Slightly.

So you can imagine, that when I got my very well priced slab featuring a wheat tortilla absolutely jammed with grilled tofu, black beans and mild sauce I went to town. It was so amazing.

From the Adrenalin Room (http://youtu.be/HM6pd8-GjGs) to the Adrenalin Burrito.

excerpts: , it is a little pricey, more than im used to and they charged for using a wheat tortilla.
Foul Ball.
tortilla.author: Ala T.
tortilla.review:
My usual burritos from Gordo's on 9th Ave. or the The New Spot in the Dogpatch. El Beach Burrito is just 3 short blocks from my house so i decided to give it a go as i was hungry, and thought a burrito would do nicely.

My brother and I walk in an notice it is deserted. Strike one. But still my stomach is willing to give it a chance. The lady at the register wasn't friendly in the least. She didn't speak English well, but she apparently felt like we were bugging here just by buying food from her restaurant. Strike Two. Okay so i finally get a super carne asada to take home, it is a little pricey, more than im used to and they charged for using a wheat tortilla. Foul Ball. The money could still be worth it if it's really good.

Nope. Strike Three and El Beach Burrito is out. A dry, flavor-poor burrito is what i got. Also they use a yellow-orange cheese that reminded me of a viscous Kraft Mac and Cheese. They were extremely cheap on pretty much everything, even the rice, resulting in a super burrito that was only super in name and price only. 

Stay away! If you're in the Outer Sunset, make the trip to 9th avenue.

excerpts: So I ate it, felt really full, and dreamed about that tortilla-wrapped log of love.
tortilla.author: Vanilla P.
tortilla.review:
On our last visit, I knew I had to get some Mex-food loving. So I went here, and cried into my fatty burrito. The burrito was fantastic, and I was crying because in MA (the hellhole where I now live), there are no burritos that even compare. The salsa bar was pretty small, but the salsas made up for the lack of selection with their overabundance of flavor. The chips were standard taqueria chips: salty and greasy, leaving the perfect mount of unhealthy film on your fingertips to lick off. Mmmm.

So I ate it, felt really full, and dreamed about that tortilla-wrapped log of love.

excerpts: I ordered a super taco, and basically they just piled and bunch of crap on a corn tortilla...which made it impossible to eat in a efficient manner.
tortilla.author: Mario W.
tortilla.review:
The food is WAY OVER PRICED, and lacks flavor.
I wouldn't say the food is disgusting, It's just not very good considering that there are tons of other places in SF were you can get a more authentic taqueria experience for a lower price.

The burritos are OK...the tacos are a joke.
I ordered a super taco, and basically they just piled and bunch of crap on a corn tortilla...which made it impossible to eat in a efficient manner.

The breakfast burrito is actually really good but thats about it.

Oh yeah...really stupid wall paintings with burritos and chili peppers with mustaches wearing hats on the beach...

excerpts: Way too loose, which left the burrito with a huge lengthwise crack running down it where the two sides of the tortilla didn't meet.
All the juices from the chicken/beans/salsa ran out of the crack, and the result was me trying to eat something akin to a large wet bag.
A pretty tasty bag though, I will concede.
Kind of shitty horchata, the second half of the cup was really gritty like they actually made it AT the beach.
I guess I should have known something was amiss at this taqueria when I saw a white person working there.
tortilla.author: Trav W.
tortilla.review:
Really I give this place 2.5 stars but I am rounding up because the spicy chicken is pretty good (while not being discernibly "spicy") and the basic burrito ingredients are all in place. A couple of big "buts" (which I like, and I cannot lie)...

I asked for no guacamole (I know this takes some of you aback. Get off my back you judgmental avocado snobs), and I got home to find a rather large dollop of it smeared strategically mid-burrito. There are like five ingredients in a burrito and I saw them write down "no guac" when I said it. I was literally the only person in line at the time, busyness was a non-factor. I suppose I should be congratulating them for fucking up something so difficult to fuck up. Congrats, El Beach Burrito (do they really need the "El" in their name?).

Also the roll of the burrito was poorly executed. Way too loose, which left the burrito with a huge lengthwise crack running down it where the two sides of the tortilla didn't meet. All the juices from the chicken/beans/salsa ran out of the crack, and the result was me trying to eat something akin to a large wet bag. A pretty tasty bag though, I will concede. Kind of shitty horchata, the second half of the cup was really gritty like they actually made it AT the beach. I guess I should have known something was amiss at this taqueria when I saw a white person working there.

excerpts: They have lots of tortilla options and a pretty extensive menu.
I have only ever had veggie burritos here
so I'm not sure about the meat.
Very clean place with good seating.
Not always the nicest service, but again a taqueria in the sunse
tortilla.author: Erin S.
tortilla.review: Yes its not the Mission, but for the Outer Sunset I am satisfied. Better than Gordos. Big portions, but you also are paying for them. They have lots of tortilla options and a pretty extensive menu. I have only ever had veggie burritos here so I'm not sure about the meat. Very clean place with good seating. Not always the nicest service, but again a taqueria in the sunse

excerpts: So I ordered, minding that he still had one of his raw meat gloves on, and he proceeded to put on one new glove and then pick up my tortilla WITH THE RAW MEAT GLOVE!
tortilla.author: Parker H.
tortilla.review:
This is a bit overdue, but my roomie having an unpleasant experience there as well prompted me to catch up on my reviews, starting with this one. 

Ok, so we moved into the area a little while ago, and both love burritos, so we were happy to have a place pretty close, even with a name like 'El beach burrito'... I mean you're a few blocks from a street called 'La Playa', not much of a stretch... 

So the first few times either of us went there went without a hitch, but the last time I went there, which will be the last time I ever go there, was pretty bad. I went up there with my buddy and walked into an empty restaurant. There was a woman in an apron, who I later found out was the owner, sitting at the front with a friend. I saw the line cook or whatever you want to call him back at sink washing some beef. I got to counter to order. He immediately came over took of a glove to handle the pen, and started to take my order. One of the few things I can do in spanish, is order a burrito, I find it usually helps get my order right. So I ordered, minding that he still had one of his raw meat gloves on, and he proceeded to put on one new glove and then pick up my tortilla WITH THE RAW MEAT GLOVE! 

Now I by no means am a germaphobe, but come on, especially right in front of my, that's obscene. So, once again in spanish, I politely asked him to change his gloves. As I was doing this the owner had walked over to take my friends order. I didn't notice, partially because she didn't get my attention, but apparently she gave me a pretty bad glare. The guy making my burrito was, nice and apologetic, he offered to get me a new burrito, and apologized which is all I ask for. A simple apology and remedy. As I am in the industry, that is one of the first things your learn. So he continued to make my burrito. As I was paying, the owner came up to ring me up. After I had paid, still with no acknowledgment from her, I brought up the issue, because maybe he didn't know. But  I know damn well she knows about health code, let alone common hygiene. 

I simply said, "I'm not trying to be rude, and I'm not trying to get anyone in trouble, but you need to make sure he knows' (this is where she interrupts and informs me she's the owner) 'that if he is handling raw meat, he needs to at minimum change his gloves, if not wash his hands thoroughly." She barely acknowledged me, no "sorry", no "thank you", no comp or discount, almost the contrary.  I mean this was an egregious health code violation, for which I would have been well within my rights to throw a fit and even call the authorities. It just shows poor ownership/management ability, which is probably why she owns a flailing spot called "El Beach Burrito"... her loss because, my roommie and I each eat at least one burrito a week @ about $8 a pop, your looking at a minimum of about $1000/year lost revenue. At a place like that, that could make a difference. Plus none of my friends or guests, and all the people that decide not to go because of this, probably a much greater number. But whatever, her loss, in such a fickle industry she should work on the basics.

Final note: My roomies experience consisted of him getting there at 8:40, when the close at 9, and being immediately and very rudely greeted at the door by the same woman with a "WE'RE CLOSED!" I recommend a business that requires less human interaction lady!

excerpts: I get a veggie burrito on wheat tortilla for $7.45 and it's a lot of food.
They've always been fairly nice to me
and i've never had any issues.
Overall I'd recommend the place
and I go there pretty regularly.
tortilla.author: B K.
tortilla.review: I live down the street and I go here alll the time. The food isn't the best, but it's very reasonable and tasty. I get a veggie burrito on wheat tortilla for $7.45 and it's a lot of food. They've always been fairly nice to me and i've never had any issues. Overall I'd recommend the place and I go there pretty regularly.

excerpts: If you're ordering a non-meat burrito, don't expect it to be remotely warm - even if they use the tortilla steamers, it really doesn't make a difference.
tortilla.author: Lena B.
tortilla.review:
I was so excited to have a taqueria open so close to my house, but after numerous trips I gave up on the hope that it would "get better."

Everything is dry and bland. The meat is dry, the beans are dry, the rice is dry and often partially uncooked. If you're ordering a non-meat burrito, don't expect it to be remotely warm - even if they use the tortilla steamers, it really doesn't make a difference. 

Big disappointment - if you're in the area and absolutely want mexican food, go to Celia's a block away. The food there is much better.

excerpts: Had a variety of tortillas.
Chips were crispy.
Salsa needs improvement 2 starts for that.
Green salsa was sweet and hot.
tortillas.author: Attic F.
tortillas.review:
Not bad. Meat wasn't dry. Rice was a bit bland. Not overly salted (I hate when restaurants do this). Had a variety of tortillas. Chips were crispy. Salsa needs improvement 2 starts for that. Green salsa was sweet and hot. The darker roasted salsa was the best, but having tasted superior salsas not enough to give 3 stars. 

If you live on irving close than a trip to the mission. Go to the mission.

excerpts: The bf said his dish was a substantial amount of food (a whole platter of stuff AND a basket of chips + tortillas), but nothing special.
tortillas.author: Miss H.
tortillas.review:
So one of my besties SWEARS by this place, and I finally tried it... and I have to say, El Burrito Express on Taraval will always have my heart (and stomach!). I got the super carne asada quesadilla and horchata, and the bf got the huevos... mexicana? something. I thought my quesadilla was ok - a little too much sour cream and I felt like the flavors just weren't there. The horchata was suuuper cinnamon-y and sweet. The bf said his dish was a substantial amount of food (a whole platter of stuff AND a basket of chips + tortillas), but nothing special.

I will say though, that this burrito joint is definitely more spacious and cleaner than the typical and one of the few places to dine at in the area!

excerpts: Everything except tortillas is made from scratch every morning.
That means no canned tomatoes and no powdered agua frescas!
They use no lard in ANYTHING so even the refried beans are vegitarian.
If you are a meat eater you will never find fat or grizel in your food because they buy good quality meat and trim even that.
The cooks season the food gently as to not overwhelm those with a more delicate palate but make sure there is plenty of salsa,and peppers so you can add heat to your liking.
This is a family owned business and the owner grew up only blocks from the restaurant.
He hires a variety of people,pays them a fair wage and treats them like family.
He contributes to the sunset community  in more ways than can be written in this review.
This is what you pay for QUALITY!
tortillas.author: j c.
tortillas.review: Im giving this place 5 stars! here is why. The food is always fresh. Everything except tortillas is made from scratch every morning. That means no canned tomatoes and no powdered agua frescas! They use no lard in ANYTHING so even the refried beans are vegitarian. If you are a meat eater you will never find fat or grizel in your food because they buy good quality meat and trim even that. The cooks season the food gently as to not overwhelm those with a more delicate palate but make sure there is plenty of salsa,and peppers so you can add heat to your liking. This is a family owned business and the owner grew up only blocks from the restaurant. He hires a variety of people,pays them a fair wage and treats them like family. He contributes to the sunset community  in more ways than can be written in this review. This is what you pay for QUALITY!

excerpts: Tortillas, cheese, and sour cream were considered as extras and up to 70 cents more.
I thought it was going to e cheap but everything came out to like $10.
What I didn't like was that my girlfriend who is a vegetarian asked if the beans are cooked with meat and the guy who was making our burritos said "I don't know I don't make the food here.
Ugh so annoying.
tortillas.author: Naila S.
tortillas.review: Do not eat here! My friends and I were looking for a cheap taqueria by the beach. We were excited to see el beach burrito so close to the beach. When we got inside the first thing I noticed was the extras in the corner. Tortillas, cheese, and sour cream were considered as extras and up to 70 cents more. I thought it was going to e cheap but everything came out to like $10. What I didn't like was that my girlfriend who is a vegetarian asked if the beans are cooked with meat and the guy who was making our burritos said "I don't know I don't make the food here." Ugh so annoying. I ordered a fish burrito thinking that it'd be a fun treat. When I saw him take the raw fish out to cook it was out of an old tupperware and the fish was grey and gross looking. When we finally got our burritos after at least 20 minutes all four of my friends and I were disappointed. It was dry and bland. Definitely a let down. The service was bad and so was the food-not to mention way over priced!!! Nobody come here!

excerpts: Choice of tortillas, and healthy (vegetarian - non lardy) bean options, spacious place to eat with all your friends, and located in an excellent quite neighborhood near the muni and beach.
tortillas.author: Vicky B.
tortillas.review:
I dig this place for being in the Sunset amongst all the non-mexican restaurants.  Also, I double dig this place for having incredibly tasty veggie options!

Excellent tofu burritos, if not a little too big, as I never seem to finish.  Choice of tortillas, and healthy (vegetarian - non lardy) bean options, spacious place to eat with all your friends, and located in an excellent quite neighborhood near the muni and beach.

My new favorite is the two veggie tacos (grilled yummines!) that come with beans, rice, salad and quacamole when you get the extra "dinner" option (and cheap too!).

Don't know about the meat options, but if you're veggie and in the Sunset -- best Mexican place around.

excerpts: large chunks of fresh grilled mahi mahi on corn tortillas with chunky "fresh" salsa fresca.
the entire facility is clean and well lit.
tortillas.author: Playa A.
tortillas.review:
i have only had the fish tacos there and i think they are very good. large chunks of fresh grilled mahi mahi on corn tortillas with chunky "fresh" salsa fresca.  the entire facility is clean and well lit. the salsa bar has a decent selection of very fresh choices.

the kitchen staff doesn't use lard but does use NON-hydrogenated veggie oil to prepare all there dishes.   when i asked about the oils they happily addressed all of my questions with a smile. 

6  visits and counting

excerpts: I ordered fish taco and shrimp taco.
It was bland.
The fish was just seasoned with salt and pepper (andddd under-seasoned).
Not even a drop of spice unique to mexican food was there.
Shrimp taco is same treatment.
Let's move to the homemade salsa bar.
WORST salsas ever.
No flavor, lack or no seasonings.
The entire meal was a waste of money.
fish.author: Shinta L.
fish.review: The worst mexican food I have ever had. Overpriced too. I ordered fish taco and shrimp taco. It was bland. The fish was just seasoned with salt and pepper (andddd under-seasoned). Not even a drop of spice unique to mexican food was there. There was nothing Mexican about the entire flavor except for the fact that it was served on a piece of corn tortilla topped with slightly salted beans and tomatoes that seemed to have been treated to resemble salsa. Shrimp taco is same treatment. Let's move to the homemade salsa bar. WORST salsas ever. No flavor, lack or no seasonings. The entire meal was a waste of money.

excerpts: The fish tacos are BOMB!
So happy to have stumbled upon this place!
Unfortunately they didn't have guacamole but the tacos made up for it!
fish.author: Molly B.
fish.review: The fish tacos are BOMB! So happy to have stumbled upon this place! Unfortunately they didn't have guacamole but the tacos made up for it!

excerpts: I'm getting the best fish or steak, and not Taco Bell quality Mexican food.
fish.author: Brittany R.
fish.review: Quality place owned by a quality native San Franciscan.  They use the best meat - legit, high end stuff (even their tofu!).  I'm happy to pay a little more knowing I'm getting the best fish or steak, and not Taco Bell quality Mexican food.

excerpts: The fish burrito here is the best I have ever had!
The burritos are large and the service is fast, plus there are plenty of choices on the menu.
I've tried their Carnitas as well which is as delicious as anything you'll find in the Mission.
Great for Mexican food lovers who feel "stranded" in the Sunset.
I'll be coming back here often!
fish.author: Eric L.
fish.review: The fish burrito here is the best I have ever had! The burritos are large and the service is fast, plus there are plenty of choices on the menu. I've tried their Carnitas as well which is as delicious as anything you'll find in the Mission.  Great for Mexican food lovers who feel "stranded" in the Sunset. I'll be coming back here often!

excerpts: I am mainly vegetarian but occasionally eat fish, and this place has OPTIONS!:  a veggie burrito, a grilled vegetables burrito,
a beans and rice burrito, a tofu burrito, a fish burrito, a prawn burrito, and my favorite, the chile relleno burrito.
fish.author: Alison Y.
fish.review:
Okay, let's just start off by stating the obvious: no, this is not a place in the Mission. However, it is one of a very few Mexican places in the outer sunset, and I have found that El Beach Burrito far outshines their neighborhood competition.

1. Lots of choices, especially if you don't eat very many meat products. I am mainly vegetarian but occasionally eat fish, and this place has OPTIONS!:  a veggie burrito, a grilled vegetables burrito, a beans and rice burrito, a tofu burrito, a fish burrito, a prawn burrito, and my favorite, the chile relleno burrito.

2. Decent size and not horribly expensive. Yes, you pay $1.50 more for a 'super' burrito, but even the regular burritos are large. Plus they give you a decent amount of chips and you can take as much salsa as you'd like from their salsa bar.

3. Friendly staff. The two guys who run the cash register have always been super nice and happy. Even the cook staff has always been smiling when I'm in there.

Those three things alone make this a far preferable option (in my opinion) than La Playa on Noriega. Plus I like the flavors of their burritos far more as well.

excerpts: If you're in the area and looking for some mexican food, I would suggest going across the street to Celia's or even better go down a few blocks to La Playa Taqueria over on Noriega, great fish tacos.
fish.author: Mike S.
fish.review:
Just like the other reviews, Beach Burrito is horrible.  Bland burritos with a side of rudeness.

I've been here a few times and it's the same bland food and poor service every time.  The only reason I came back is the lack of fast food in the area.  

After today, I'm never going back.  I stopped in tonight to get a burrito and was completely ignored by the employee who was taking the orders.  He was chatting up storm with someone else and wouldn't stop talking to take my order.  After about 7 mins of waiting I left.

If you're in the area and looking for some mexican food, I would suggest going across the street to Celia's or even better go down a few blocks to La Playa Taqueria over on Noriega, great fish tacos.

When we finally got our burritos after at least 20 minutes all four of my friends and I were disappointed.
It was dry and bland.
Definitely a let down.
The service was bad and so was the food-not to mention way over priced!!!
Nobody come here!

and i think they are very good.

excerpts: they have good choices and im pretty fond of the fish burrito myself...
fish.author: Anthony Z.
fish.review:
sweet spot!  if im not getting chicken tiki masala after a night of drinking than im prolly here getting a burrito...  they have good choices and im pretty fond of the fish burrito myself... its cheaper than most the others and really good... 

me coming from So Cal with all the taco joints down there I have to say I was pretty stoked to find this spot when I did!  Highly recommend it...

excerpts: All sour cream & lettuce; barely any cheese; and carne asada was like teeny-tiny rabbit poop pellets.
lettuce.author: M F.
lettuce.review:
Friends warned us.

Only thing super about my $10.75 "Super Meat Quesadilla" was that it was SUPER overpriced. All sour cream & lettuce; barely any cheese; and carne asada was like teeny-tiny rabbit poop pellets.

$5.95 shrimp taco wasn't worth paying more than $1.50, $1.75 tops.

$8.45 "Meat Burrito" was just rice and beans. No flavor. Shouldn't have paid more than $4.

Damn. $37 waste on bad food and lazy service when you see her sitting down at the counter by the window & he's sitting on the stairs looking at his cell. Heaven forbid they wipe down the tables & push in the chairs. That's what customers are for, right?

excerpts: I pointed to the menu and the other person working there explained to them what it was, which apparently is carne aside (maybe just beef) beans, lettuce, pico, sour cream and guacamole.
lettuce.author: Jennifer P.
lettuce.review:
We ate here after getting off the MUNI, arriving in town to start our vacation.  We tried to go to Outlanders but they seated multiple tables before us (I assume because we had suitcases and requested an outdoor table).

I should have known better than to try Mexican when I live in SD which is known for its taco shops, but we were on vacation and I wanted to live dangerously.  We ordered the super nachos to split.  It was annoying trying to order as the menu is on TVs and it changed screens every so many seconds.  

When we went to order the super nachos the person taking the order did not know what they were and looked confused.  I pointed to the menu and the other person working there explained to them what it was, which apparently is carne aside (maybe just beef) beans, lettuce, pico, sour cream and guacamole.  

The meat was not very flavorful, nor the beans.  The chips were nice and crisp.  They had a salsa bar and I tried the spicy salsa and the green chiles salsa.  The green chiles salsa had almost no taste and was watery.  The spicy was not very spicy.  

Overall it was a disappointing experience.  The restaurant was not busy when we were there )2 other tables full) had 2 employees working and there were dirty unbussed tables in the dining room.  Also lots of flies in the restaurant which may have been because the front doors were left open and it was close to the beach, but not appetizing when dining.

excerpts: It's is all sour cream and lettuce, and the only cheese on it is melted into the container.
What a disappointment.
I don't know why I bother with this place.
lettuce.author: Dawn B.
lettuce.review: This place is such a hit or miss. Just order super chicken nachoes. It's is all sour cream and lettuce, and the only cheese on it is melted into the container. What a disappointment. I don't know why I bother with this place.

excerpts: terrible -$8.50 for black beans rice cheese and lettuce burrito  - terrible atmosphere, terrible customer service - no flavor at all.
zero stars
lettuce.author: Gigi F.
lettuce.review: terrible -$8.50 for black beans rice cheese and lettuce burrito  - terrible atmosphere, terrible customer service - no flavor at all. zero stars

excerpts: do not get a super carne asada quesadilla unless you want to pay $11.69 for no meat, a ton of lettuce and if you dont expect to get your hunger satisfied.
seriously, the meat is chopped up so tiny it looks like dog food.
i guess putting lettuce in a quesadilla is a beach burrito thing to trick you into thinking you are getting more than what it seems.
lettuce.author: Kelly K.
lettuce.review:
do not get a super carne asada quesadilla unless you want to pay $11.69 for no meat, a ton of lettuce and if you dont expect to get your hunger satisfied. seriously, the meat is chopped up so tiny it looks like dog food. i guess putting lettuce in a quesadilla is a beach burrito thing to trick you into thinking you are getting more than what it seems. after one bite, i was left with a watery river of "guac", sour cream and..water?

note, most of the menu is over $10 for bland, stingy portions.

excerpts: burrito we've ever had - namely because the only veggie inside it was lettuce.
Wtf.
Are you kidding me?
No peppers or mushrooms or even tomatoes and onions?
It was flavorless and heavy and kind of gross, to be honest.
Just cheese, beans, rice, and lettuce.
lettuce.author: Carly G.
lettuce.review:
Oh god. I ate here a few months ago with my husband and we shared the super veggie burrito. It was honestly the most pathetic veggie burrito we've ever had - namely because the only veggie inside it was lettuce. Wtf. Are you kidding me? No peppers or mushrooms or even tomatoes and onions? It was flavorless and heavy and kind of gross, to be honest. Just cheese, beans, rice, and lettuce. 

So that was a few months ago. I forgot to write a review until today, when my roommate and her boyfriend, whom I hadn't warned away from the place, decided to try it out. They also happened to get veggie burritos, and they also proclaimed them the shittiest burritos they'd ever had.

My roommate's boyfriend is now puking his guts out from said goddamn burrito.

STAY AWAY!!

excerpts: Similar to most reviews, bad service, boring, bland food and a lack of interest in pleasing the customer is what you'll get here.  never seen a super burrito that didn't come with cheese, lettuce or less than a spoonful of guac and sour cream.
but that's what they gave me.
overcooked meat and salsa that has less flavor than the safeway brand i had to put it on it to wash it down at home.
all for the low price of $9+.
do NOT go here.
walk across the street to Celia's and pay an extra $2 and be happy.
lettuce.author: Matthew L.
lettuce.review: Similar to most reviews, bad service, boring, bland food and a lack of interest in pleasing the customer is what you'll get here.  never seen a super burrito that didn't come with cheese, lettuce or less than a spoonful of guac and sour cream.  but that's what they gave me.  overcooked meat and salsa that has less flavor than the safeway brand i had to put it on it to wash it down at home.  all for the low price of $9+.  do NOT go here.  walk across the street to Celia's and pay an extra $2 and be happy.

excerpts: Can't say that I didn't enjoy my overwhelmingly huge plate of nachos (super meaty nachos) - topped with grilled chicken (moist, but lacked a bit of flavor), guac, sour cream, black beans (just a tad dry, but the guac and sour cream made up for it) and lettuce.
The BF had a super meaty carnitas burrito.
The carnitas was better flavored than the chicken.
lettuce.author: Teresa Y.
lettuce.review:
We ate, we left, I pooed. 

El Beach Burrito is a pretty decent Mexican place in the outer Sunset. Can't say that I didn't enjoy my overwhelmingly huge plate of nachos (super meaty nachos) - topped with grilled chicken (moist, but lacked a bit of flavor), guac, sour cream, black beans (just a tad dry, but the guac and sour cream made up for it) and lettuce. The amount was more than satisfying.

The BF had a super meaty carnitas burrito. The carnitas was better flavored than the chicken. Packed with rice, black beans, guac, sour cream and, of course, meat, the burrito was hearty and warm to his stummy. 

Downside of this place is the price. For nachos and a burrito, our meal came out to $16. Wow. I don't think I've ever paid that much for Mexican food.... anywhere. Boo for that. For $16, I wish I didn't have to poo right after lunch. Man... now I'm hungry again.

excerpts: The Super Veggie Burrito consists of cheese, beans,rice and lettuce.
Not very "super veggie" since it only had one vegetable!
Lame.
Salsa has a very odd taste.
It is a very clean place though.
Also, the main reason for 1 instead of 2 stars: While ordering I received at least 5 eye rolls and 2 sighs from the waitress.
Horrible customer service.
lettuce.author: Tara M.
lettuce.review:
My first time there and I was NOT impressed. The Super Veggie Burrito consists of cheese, beans,rice and lettuce. Not very "super veggie" since it only had one vegetable!  Lame.
Salsa has a very odd taste. 
It is a very clean place though.
Also, the main reason for 1 instead of 2 stars: While ordering I received at least 5 eye rolls and 2 sighs from the waitress. Horrible customer service.

excerpts: Super annoying since I did call and was told that they were available.
I have no interest in ordering from here because of that.
super.author: Angela T.
super.review: This place came up in a search for carne asada fries. I thought it was weird that it wasn't on the menu available online. So, I called to confirm that they did in fact have carne asada fries before I left my house. And guess what........ no carne asada fries! Super annoying since I did call and was told that they were available. I have no interest in ordering from here because of that.

excerpts: I got as far as saying super burrito with carnitas
.. then he presided to ignore me until he nods that it's ready and to go pay.
super.author: Angel M.
super.review:
Came in and there where two people working, neither one acknowledge me or said hi even when I asked where to place an order (as it is not immediately clear nor is the location of the  menu).

Finally a staff member decides that I exist and asked me what I wanted. I got as far as saying super burrito with carnitas.. then he presided to ignore me until he nods that it's ready and to go pay. Note that he didn't ask me what toppings I wanted on it  nor type of beans or anything. 

I'm in a hurry so I grab it.  Asked the lady about Hot sauce she points me to the salsa bar where all of them taste exactly like the bottled variety. The food was mediocre and service shinned in failure. This is a poor excuse of a Mexican restaurant.

excerpts: Only thing super about my $10.75 "Super Meat Quesadilla" was that it was SUPER overpriced.
super.author: M F.
super.review:
Friends warned us.

Only thing super about my $10.75 "Super Meat Quesadilla" was that it was SUPER overpriced. All sour cream & lettuce; barely any cheese; and carne asada was like teeny-tiny rabbit poop pellets.

$5.95 shrimp taco wasn't worth paying more than $1.50, $1.75 tops.

$8.45 "Meat Burrito" was just rice and beans. No flavor. Shouldn't have paid more than $4.

Damn. $37 waste on bad food and lazy service when you see her sitting down at the counter by the window & he's sitting on the stairs looking at his cell. Heaven forbid they wipe down the tables & push in the chairs. That's what customers are for, right?

excerpts: I just asked for a Super Nachos with black beans to go along with the carnitas and kept it moving.
That is super cool!
The prices are very respectable and appropriate for what you get.
super.author: Robert F.
super.review:
I can get with this place.

The gentlemen working here today brought their A game. Good fresh salsa and really good carnitas. I ordered Nachos today. I was expecting a lot from this place just because I had gone to Sea Breeze yesterday and they shined bright!

I just asked for a Super Nachos with black beans to go along with the carnitas and kept it moving. As I waited for the food to be prepared I noticed that there were a few other folks enjoying their meals. 

There is a bathroom here which is nice. Not sure if it is open to anyone and everybody but having one available is a plus. You'll know how BEANS be moving in the body in such!!!! 

The cooler here has a nice selection of drinks. The freezer has some ice cream. Not the kind that I would want but a good option to have here for those hot days.

Two big TVs here for sports games. I watched some replay sports games while I was here.

My food was incredible!! The nachos had all the right portions of everything. From the salsa to the meat to the beans!! This place understands distribution and quality. This may be the first taqueria that I have been to in some time that has done this properly.

The meal was sensational. Oh, the menu is on a LCD screen as well. That is super cool! The prices are very respectable and appropriate for what you get.

excerpts: We ordered the super nachos to split.
When we went to order the super nachos the person taking the order did not know what they were and looked confused.

super.review:
We ate here after getting off the MUNI, arriving in town to start our vacation.  We tried to go to Outlanders but they seated multiple tables before us (I assume because we had suitcases and requested an outdoor table).

I should have known better than to try Mexican when I live in SD which is known for its taco shops, but we were on vacation and I wanted to live dangerously.  We ordered the super nachos to split.  It was annoying trying to order as the menu is on TVs and it changed screens every so many seconds.

I pointed to the menu and the other person working there explained to them what it was, which apparently is carne aside (maybe just beef) beans, lettuce, pico, sour cream and guacamole.

, it was just as disappointing as last time.
Mostly rice, some beans, maybe like a spoonful of guacamole, and 3 tiny morsels of meat.
It was just so dry
super.author: Sheena S.
super.review:
Last week I picked up to go order of a carne asada burrito and chips. I think I paid somewhere around $13 for it. The burrito was mostly rice and missing most of the other ingredients. 

I was left disappointed but decide to give it another go today. 

I got a super burrito this time and no surprise, it was just as disappointing as last time. Mostly rice, some beans, maybe like a spoonful of guacamole, and 3 tiny morsels of meat. It was just so dry and yes, you guessed it, disappointing. 

Here's my recommendation, go to Celia's, pay a little more but get a great burrito.

excerpts: Just order super chicken nachoes.
super.author: Dawn B.
super.review: This place is such a hit or miss. Just order super chicken nachoes. It's is all sour cream and lettuce, and the only cheese on it is melted into the container. What a disappointment. I don't know why I bother with this place.

excerpts: Just picked up my super junior burrito that I called in, and was charged almost $10.
I told the lady working that their Yelp says a super junior was only $6, & she said the prices are 10 years old.
I told the lady working that their Yelp says a super junior was only $6, & she said the prices are 10 years old.
I told the lady working that their Yelp says a super junior was only $6, & she said the prices are 10 years old.
Not only is the burrito over priced, but it is also super cold.
I will not be coming back here.
