excerpts: Super Burrito" was the worst thing I have ever eaten.
The entire thing was cold upon opening, and the hot part was unidentifiable except for some non melted cheese.
We didn't even finish the burrito we shared and are now worried about food poisoning.
This place isn't cheap either, and when paying that much for something I expect it to be good.
This was slop and clearly made by someone who hates their job.
Stop insulting Mexican food.
We shall NEVER return!
super.author: Michael B.
super.review: This place is absolutely awful. I have lived in The Sunset for years. We call it desperation burrito, only time we have come here is when Celia's is closed or we are starving. Today once again we again are reminded of why we don't go here. "Super Burrito" was the worst thing I have ever eaten. The entire thing was cold upon opening, and the hot part was unidentifiable except for some non melted cheese. We didn't even finish the burrito we shared and are now worried about food poisoning. This place isn't cheap either, and when paying that much for something I expect it to be good. This was slop and clearly made by someone who hates their job. Stop insulting Mexican food. We shall NEVER return!

excerpts: I ordered two burritos, one California ($10.50) and one super meat ($9.95).
The woman charged me $27 and some change.
At first I didn't think anything of it then I realized that things didn't add up.
Thankfully I was able to get my money back for what I was over charged.
Don't let the woman ring you up she will over charge you!
super.author: Robynn J.
super.review: THIS REVIEW IS ONLY FOR SERVICE! I ordered two burritos, one California ($10.50) and one super meat ($9.95). The woman charged me $27 and some change. At first I didn't think anything of it then I realized that things didn't add up. Thankfully I was able to get my money back for what I was over charged. Don't let the woman ring you up she will over charge you!

excerpts: At least they had a colorful and decently clean bathroom and the ladies behind the counter were super nice and friendly to us.
super.author: Erika S.
super.review:
This place gave me really mixed feelings. My friend & I were trying to decide between a several other local spots, but ended up coming here because we're cheap. Bad move. 

I figured Mexican food can't be too expensive, especially from a place called "El Beach Burrito", but we were so wrong. Their regular burrito costs $7.45 and is just that, regular. The chicken was pretty flavorful, but I don't think it could pass for a gourmet burrito for that price. I got the chorizo and egg breakfast burrito, also for $7.45, and it was alright. 

They charge $2.25 for Jarritos and $1.95 for a 99cent Arizona. Also, chips cost $1, which personally insulted my friend who happens to be Mexican. 

At least they had a colorful and decently clean bathroom and the ladies behind the counter were super nice and friendly to us.

Also, it never seems like anyone intends to come here, but instead walks in by default because Juadahlicious is out of acai or other places are too busy.

I will never make the mistake of coming back here to buy mediocre, overpriced burritos.

excerpts: I ordered a chicken super burrito which was basically only beans, rice, guacamole and sour creme with tiny pieces of chicken scattered towards the bottom.
Burrito cost me $10.50.
This place is the worst
super.author: David f.
super.review: Man and woman behind the counter were rude and extremely slow. I ordered a chicken super burrito which was basically only beans, rice, guacamole and sour creme with tiny pieces of chicken scattered towards the bottom. Burrito cost me $10.50. This place is the worst

excerpts: I just ordered a veggie burrito and ordered it super.
My burrito was $11 and was at least half rice
and I don't think I found any cheese or guacamole in my burrito.....
Don't waste your money.
super.author: Amy G.
super.review: I just ordered a veggie burrito and ordered it super. My burrito was $11 and was at least half rice and I don't think I found any cheese or guacamole in my burrito.....Don't waste your money.

excerpts: A regular burrito here costs as much as, if not more, than a super burrito elsewhere.
The place was understaffed and I had to wait a relatively long time for my burrito.
Overall, the burrito left me full
super.author: Wing C.
super.review:
TL;DR 
con: Sub-par customer service, understaffed, expensive meal.
pro: Decent serving size, pretty tasty, sit down location.

I went here with a couple of homies since this was the closest burrito joint. The vibe and atmosphere was chill and we had a table to sit down at. It was a hot day and i decided to get a regular chicken burrito with an ice cold Arizona green tea to go along with it. You know how Arizona green tea is a dollar everywhere you go right? Well, here at Beach Burrito, it's $2 even though the can says $1. I didn't know this until the lady at the checkout counter told me in an apologetic voice that "sorry, it's the boss' decision"... To me, that's deception and just shady business.

Other than that, the burrito that i got was tasty albeit expensive. A regular burrito here costs as much as, if not more, than a super burrito elsewhere. The place was understaffed and I had to wait a relatively long time for my burrito. Overall, the burrito left me full but I'm still disappointed at the price and service.

I've definitely experienced better and won't be eating here again.

excerpts: overpriced surf & turf burrito..originally menu stated $12.95 then lady asked if i wanted guac, cheese & sour cream which would make it a 'super' burrito.
i understand it would cost extra but at checkout, the burrito came out to $15.70.
For that price, i could have had the surf & turf fajitas at celia's by the beach next block over (it's roughly $17-$20 there with actual table service & delicious food).
my usual go to place is El burrito express on taraval
but they're closed sundays
so gave this place a go.
The same $16 price would get me a el macho burrito from el burrito express (which is a double length super meat burrito good to share with 2 ppl)
I didn't even get any chips either...
super.author: Yolanda L.
super.review:
overpriced surf & turf burrito..originally menu stated $12.95 then lady asked if i wanted guac, cheese & sour cream which would make it a 'super' burrito. i understand it would cost extra but at checkout, the burrito came out to $15.70. For that price, i could have had the surf & turf fajitas at celia's by the beach next block over (it's roughly $17-$20 there with actual table service & delicious food). my usual go to place is El burrito express on taraval but they're closed sundays so gave this place a go. The same $16 price would get me a el macho burrito from el burrito express (which is a double length super meat burrito good to share with 2 ppl)
I didn't even get any chips either...does that cost extra????

parking is a pain in ass too.

excerpts: I can't understand why they are so unfriendly here , it's a laid back neighborhood , and not super busy ..food is only so so
super.author: kim h.
super.review: I can't understand why they are so unfriendly here , it's a laid back neighborhood , and not super busy ..food is only so so

excerpts: Whenever we are in the area, we look forward to getting a super carnitas burrito.
They cook their meat a little bit longer so that it is just the right amount of crisp and inner softness.
They have excellent homemade salsa verde and hot sauce.
The service is very friendly and accommodating.
I always get food to go, but the venue itself has quite a bit of space to easily hang out with a few friends.
super.author: Gaby E.
super.review: Love their carnitas! Whenever we are in the area, we look forward to getting a super carnitas burrito. They cook their meat a little bit longer so that it is just the right amount of crisp and inner softness. They have excellent homemade salsa verde and hot sauce. The service is very friendly and accommodating. I always get food to go, but the venue itself has quite a bit of space to easily hang out with a few friends.

excerpts: The sizeable super veggie nachos feature sautéed zucchini, squash, onions, and bell peppers and pack a nice, spicy punch.
What the burritos lack in flavor they make up for in size.
The chicken burrito is good, but lacking in the intense flavors that a true Mission-style burrito would deliver.
super.author: CJ G.
super.review:
While not a rival to the best of the Mission, El Beach Burrito provides reasonably good Mexican fare in the Sunset.

A friendly and casual place, El Beach Burrito is not trying to be creative, just to put out some solid Mexican at a reasonable price.  The sizeable super veggie nachos feature sautéed zucchini, squash, onions, and bell peppers and pack a nice, spicy punch.  What the burritos lack in flavor they make up for in size.  The chicken burrito is good, but lacking in the intense flavors that a true Mission-style burrito would deliver.  Another variable is the tortilla chips:  they vary from good and fresh to tasting like they came from Costco.

Depending on when you go, the service can be friendly or spaced out.

If you are in the Sunset with a craving for Mexican, El Beach Burrito will do; if you are looking for high quality burritos or tacos, hop on Muni and get over to the Mission.

excerpts: My "super taco" was $5 and it didn't even come with chips.
My taco was mostly sour cream with a little bit of beef.
super.author: Andrew V.
super.review:
Overpriced!!! In all seriousness, Mexican food is one of the cheapest types of food to order. San Francisco offers dozens of affordable/tasty dining choices. 

My "super taco" was $5 and it didn't even come with chips. My taco was mostly sour cream with a little bit of beef. I was disappointed. 

The only reason I went here was because, I was waiting for my smoothie next door @ Judalicious. I won't be back!! Damn cheapies... #bye #nothankyou

excerpts: do not get a super carne asada quesadilla unless you want to pay $11.69 for no meat, a ton of lettuce and if you dont expect to get your hunger satisfied.
seriously, the meat is chopped up so tiny it looks like dog food.
i guess putting lettuce in a quesadilla is a beach burrito thing to trick you into thinking you are getting more than what it seems.
super.author: Kelly K.
super.review:
do not get a super carne asada quesadilla unless you want to pay $11.69 for no meat, a ton of lettuce and if you dont expect to get your hunger satisfied. seriously, the meat is chopped up so tiny it looks like dog food. i guess putting lettuce in a quesadilla is a beach burrito thing to trick you into thinking you are getting more than what it seems. after one bite, i was left with a watery river of "guac", sour cream and..water?

note, most of the menu is over $10 for bland, stingy portions.

excerpts: I got the Super Chicken burrito and the portion size was hefty!
Flavorful and perfectly made.
super.author: Olivia B.
super.review:
Ate here once out of a desperate craving for a burrito and no patience to travel inbound to the Mission.
Definitely, not a Mission burrito, but the best taqueria I've hit out in these parts of town! (If you're in the Outer Richmond I would go to Chino's).

I got the Super Chicken burrito and the portion size was hefty! Flavorful and perfectly made.
On a second visit I got the Prawn Burrito. It was a bit too salty for my liking.

Things to note:
- Homemade salsa bar
- Must pay for Chips
- Lots of seating inside, but also some outdoor seating for those rare sunny Outer Sunset days

excerpts: so the burrito I got was delicious, shrimp super, low on rice - more veggies ROCKED!!
super.author: Rew C.
super.review:
I've eaten here many times and the food and service are good. Not a lot of spice but they're serving the outer sunset crowd which apparently isn't what that neighborhood is looking for. 

I asked for it and Jay, - this guy is really cool, gave me some jalapeno's to give me a kick. The salsas are good, one had a little kick- and they're homemade. So maybe if you ask for it they will spice them up in the future.

More so the burrito I got was delicious, shrimp super, low on rice - more veggies ROCKED!!

excerpts: Paid $10 for a "super" carne asada burrito, they forgot to include cheese, guac or sour cream.
Meat was gristly and gross, way too much rice and the flavor was totally bland.
Go literally anywhere else.
super.author: Brendan R.
super.review: Just terrible. Paid $10 for a "super" carne asada burrito, they forgot to include cheese, guac or sour cream. Meat was gristly and gross, way too much rice and the flavor was totally bland. Go literally anywhere else.

excerpts:
Super Burrito (1/2 Rice, 1/4 Beans, 1/8 Guac & Sour Cream, 1/8 Meat), Salsa Bar extremely lacking (No Pico de Gallo, 2 Salsas), Chips cold, stale and flavorless

Price:
super.author: Consumer F.
super.review:
Read the previous reviews and decided to try it anyways. Big Mistake

Service: Non-Existant

Food: Super Burrito (1/2 Rice, 1/4 Beans, 1/8 Guac & Sour Cream, 1/8 Meat), Salsa Bar extremely lacking (No Pico de Gallo, 2 Salsas), Chips cold, stale and flavorless

Price: Given the terrible quality, very expensive $13 for Mediocre Burrito, Tasteless Chips and Drink (Jarritos)

Ambiance: Infomercials on the TV

Would not recommend.

If you are walking by. Keep walking.

excerpts: Stopped here for a super chicken burrito, but it wasn't very satisfying.

For $9.95, I would expect a huge burrito with lots of filling, but got a very small one (compared with other "super" burritos I've had elsewhere) with not much chicken or other goodies and rice that was under cooked.
If you look at their prices on the web, just be aware that those are NOT the current prices...
it's about $3 more for lots of items now.
I also paid an extra $1 to have a small order of chips, but they weren't very good either... not very crispy or fresh tasting.
The only saving grace was that they have a salsa bar, so you can help yourself to as much as you want/need.
Also, the guy taking my money was nice and friendly.
super.author: Annie W.
super.review: Stopped here for a super chicken burrito, but it wasn't very satisfying. For $9.95, I would expect a huge burrito with lots of filling, but got a very small one (compared with other "super" burritos I've had elsewhere) with not much chicken or other goodies and rice that was under cooked. If you look at their prices on the web, just be aware that those are NOT the current prices... it's about $3 more for lots of items now. I also paid an extra $1 to have a small order of chips, but they weren't very good either... not very crispy or fresh tasting. The only saving grace was that they have a salsa bar, so you can help yourself to as much as you want/need.  Also, the guy taking my money was nice and friendly.

excerpts: I ate here a few months ago with my husband and we shared the super veggie burrito.
It was honestly the most pathetic veggie
super.author: Carly G.
super.review:
Oh god. I ate here a few months ago with my husband and we shared the super veggie burrito. It was honestly the most pathetic veggie burrito we've ever had - namely because the only veggie inside it was lettuce. Wtf. Are you kidding me? No peppers or mushrooms or even tomatoes and onions? It was flavorless and heavy and kind of gross, to be honest. Just cheese, beans, rice, and lettuce. 

So that was a few months ago. I forgot to write a review until today, when my roommate and her boyfriend, whom I hadn't warned away from the place, decided to try it out. They also happened to get veggie burritos, and they also proclaimed them the shittiest burritos they'd ever had.

My roommate's boyfriend is now puking his guts out from said goddamn burrito.

STAY AWAY!!

excerpts: Trekking back through a 10block hike through the Sunset I finally get to chomping my eagerly awaited Asada Super Burrito.
5 bites in realize I haven't hit any meat.
6 bites in I started questioning the Burrito
and if they accidentally gave me some hippi vegan burrito by mistake.
No mistake as the manager Elvira explained to me...
The owner enforces a strict one scoop policy on all super burritos.
Enraged for not spending 30 dollars on some burritos
super.author: Victor H.
super.review: After spending 30 dollars on two burritos and some extras I was really looking forward to a hearty steak burrito in the Set with a good friend.  After a charge for chips and salsa were added to the total I reluctantly still tipped 3 bucks in the tip jar thinking well hey its not the workers who make the prices up so why should I sub the cost of the  chip money out of the workers tips that I'm donating, especially for something ALL Mexican places practically smother you in as a mini snack to eat before the awesome authentic taste that comes along with spices and meats such as Asada, Barbacoa, Tripas and so forth....SF Burrito Joints have to offer.   Trekking back through a 10block hike through the Sunset I finally get to chomping my eagerly awaited Asada Super Burrito.  5 bites in realize I haven't hit any meat. 6 bites in I started questioning the Burrito and if they accidentally gave me some hippi vegan burrito by mistake. No mistake as the manager Elvira explained to me... The owner enforces a strict one scoop policy on all super burritos. Enraged for not spending 30 dollars on some burritos Del Taco would give more meat attention Elvira really went above and beyond to make the matter right. She was a stellar employee who turned the situation around.  I went into the call back inquiry full well knowing that the poor workers are thinking they did something wrong but I was very impressed by Elvira diffusal of the situation.  Elvira kudos to you for keeping me as a well tipping and appreciative customer however to the Owner: Shame on you sir for being so Barato with the meat.  You run an upscale spot in a upper class area. People don't want to be nickel and dimed for free chips otherwise elsewhere but they sure as hell dont want to find out the misleading and seemingly cheatfull formula you enforce to squeeze a dollar more from each so called valued customer.  My advice for what it's worth: is give people what they pay for at the very least. And if you want to stand out- make sure that your customer takes note of how generous the portions are. Establish a Rapport with your clientele and then you establish repeat business and free marketing when they blab to their friends how amazing their fav burrito spot is.  You should lower your own pay and give your workers a raise for dealing with insightful shoppers who feel cheated, because apparently Elvira told us that unfortunately those kinds of complaints happen on the daily.   Elvira has convinced me to come again. I hope to enjoy my food their one day and save the extra hour from having to go back and make a case.  Good day sir and buena suerte.

excerpts: I ordered a super meat burrito with chicken asado (chicken, beans, rice, salsa, guac, and cheese).
The guac is nice and they do add a lot of it in it.
The chicken was pretty good as well.
super.author: Nina Y.
super.review:
This place is really average. 

I ordered a super meat burrito with chicken asado (chicken, beans, rice, salsa, guac, and cheese). The guac is nice and they do add a lot of it in it. The chicken was pretty good as well. They do have some chips, but really, they are stale. 

The horchata and cantaloupe agua fresca was really good too. I got the horchata, but I do wish that I got the cantaloupe instead. It was good!

Pretty good food. Not amazing.

excerpts: I ordered a super burrito, its most expensive at $8 and you are going to charge me another $1 for chips?
Come on.
There are places with better burritos and self serve chips.
Next, I order two burritos
and you get my order wrong.
Then, I ask for it spicy and what I get is a bland burrito better served in Sioux Falls, South Dakota.
On the positive side, the place was clean and the burrito was good sized.
With few options in the Outer Sunset this may be a last resort place but I would try to hold off for something else.
super.author: Kevin A.
super.review: Not a fan.   First, they charge for chips.  I ordered a super burrito, its most expensive at $8 and you are going to charge me another $1 for chips?  Come on.  There are places with better burritos and self serve chips.  Next, I order two burritos and you get my order wrong.  Then, I ask for it spicy and what I get is a bland burrito better served in Sioux Falls, South Dakota.  On the positive side, the place was clean and the burrito was good sized.   With few options in the Outer Sunset this may be a last resort place but I would try to hold off for something else.

excerpts: The chips were also awesome and their hot sauces - both green (lime/avocado) and red - were super flavourful.
super.author: Malloreigh M.
super.review:
My girlfriend swears that these are the best vegan burritos in San Francisco. I was impressed by the number of choices, including several vegan/vegetarian choices, and the size of the burrito was unbeatable for the price - we spent $7 and got a huge package of pinto beans, flavourful rice, guacamole, and grilled veg. The chips were also awesome and their hot sauces - both green (lime/avocado) and red - were super flavourful.

I'll go back!

excerpts: The burrito was huge and so flavorful, their salsas were super tasty and that horchata mmmm.
super.author: Stephanie H.
super.review:
I stopped by El Beach Burrito today in hopes of finding a yummy breakfast burrito. All I have to say is winning! $7.50 for a veggie breakfast burrito with tons of guacamole. And $2 for a homemade horchata. The burrito was huge and so flavorful, their salsas were super tasty and that horchata mmmm. Plus free chips and unlimited salsa bar. 

They had TONS of choices on their menu and plenty of additions to make your experience all your own. 

I am very happy with my decision. Oh yeah, the cashier was doing a nice job of small talk, not taking it too far but being very nice :) 

And reggae music in the background.

excerpts: I got the super carne asada quesadilla and horchata, and the bf got the huevos... mexicana? something.
I thought my quesadilla was ok - a little too much sour cream
and I felt like the flavors just weren't there.
The horchata was suuuper cinnamon-y and sweet.
super.author: Miss H.
super.review:
So one of my besties SWEARS by this place, and I finally tried it... and I have to say, El Burrito Express on Taraval will always have my heart (and stomach!). I got the super carne asada quesadilla and horchata, and the bf got the huevos... mexicana? something. I thought my quesadilla was ok - a little too much sour cream and I felt like the flavors just weren't there. The horchata was suuuper cinnamon-y and sweet. The bf said his dish was a substantial amount of food (a whole platter of stuff AND a basket of chips + tortillas), but nothing special.

I will say though, that this burrito joint is definitely more spacious and cleaner than the typical and one of the few places to dine at in the area!

excerpts: I got the super burrito with spicy chicken and my boyfriend got the quesadilla with carnitas.
Both were a lot better than we thought!
super.author: Marissa C.
super.review:
We wanted acai bowls at the store next door, when they ran out of acai we decided to leave to find food elsewhere and decided to give this place a try. 

I got the super burrito with spicy chicken and my boyfriend got the quesadilla with carnitas. Both were a lot better than we thought! Theres a sauce bar with salsas and jalapenos. I would come back if in the area again.

excerpts: The horchata drink is perfect, the super vegetarian burrito is pretty good, and I don't like too much else.
super.author: Deanna K.
super.review:
That's right, just A-OK. 

The horchata drink is perfect, the super vegetarian burrito is pretty good, and I don't like too much else.

excerpts:
I'm addicted to their "Super Nachos!"
I've eaten here serveral times.
Since I've had the joy of scarfing down their Super Meat Nachos.
I'm a pretty healthy guy, but the past month I've came here and downed their Super Nachos once or twice a week like I haven't eaten in days .
super.author: Tip S.
super.review:
I'm addicted to their "Super Nachos!"
I've eaten here serveral times. Since I've had the joy of scarfing down their Super Meat Nachos. It's all I think about.

I'm a pretty healthy guy, but the past month I've came here and downed their Super Nachos once or twice a week like I haven't eaten in days . The service here isn't bad, but for the area this is the tastiest Mexican cuisine around.

I don't understand the bad reviews, but there's always a scrumptious Mexican restaurant in every area. This is the Outer Sunset one!

excerpts: The staff is SUPER friendly and helpful.
super.author: Ruth R.
super.review:
This place rules. Seriously. I order a black bean no rice veggie burrito in a spinach wrap almost every time I go. I've also had their tacos, but not much else. However, I've taken tons of friends here and they all love it as much as I do. The staff is SUPER friendly and helpful. I love tipping them. 

Let's see... oh. The horchata (sp?) is phenomenal. They also make killer guac, which is the defining feature of a taqueria (in my book).

Their proximity to glorious ocean beach is also a giant plus.

excerpts: Yes, you pay $1.50 more for a 'super' burrito, but even the regular burritos are large.
The two guys who run the cash register have always been super nice and happy.
super.author: Alison Y.
super.review:
Okay, let's just start off by stating the obvious: no, this is not a place in the Mission. However, it is one of a very few Mexican places in the outer sunset, and I have found that El Beach Burrito far outshines their neighborhood competition.

1. Lots of choices, especially if you don't eat very many meat products. I am mainly vegetarian but occasionally eat fish, and this place has OPTIONS!:  a veggie burrito, a grilled vegetables burrito, a beans and rice burrito, a tofu burrito, a fish burrito, a prawn burrito, and my favorite, the chile relleno burrito.

2. Decent size and not horribly expensive. Yes, you pay $1.50 more for a 'super' burrito, but even the regular burritos are large. Plus they give you a decent amount of chips and you can take as much salsa as you'd like from their salsa bar.

3. Friendly staff. The two guys who run the cash register have always been super nice and happy. Even the cook staff has always been smiling when I'm in there.

Those three things alone make this a far preferable option (in my opinion) than La Playa on Noriega. Plus I like the flavors of their burritos far more as well.

excerpts: Then we ordered - a veggie burrito and a super quesadilla.
And the food was GOOD.
And there was LOTS of it
(I couldn't even finish my quesadilla).
super.author: Rachelle P.
super.review:
This place doesn't get very good Yelp reviews, but I thought it was totally fine!  

We walked in, it was clean.  This is good.  Then we went over to look at the menu and order and a cook said "Hi Friends."  That was cute.  I liked him.  Then we ordered - a veggie burrito and a super quesadilla.  And the food was GOOD.  And there was LOTS of it (I couldn't even finish my quesadilla).  They also had a little salsa bar, which didn't have the biggest variety, but what they did have were the two best kinds of salsa to have - a roasted red pepper salsa and a tomatillo avocado salsa.  

The only complaints/suggestions that I have are:
1.)  The counter woman wasn't half as rude as the previous reviews stated, but she wasn't a bowl of peaches.  I know you're a cashier at a beach burrito joint lady, but things could be worse. 
2.)  Salsa was good, but it needed some salt!  And I couldn't find a shaker :(

We'll be back though!

excerpts: I ordered a super burrito and it was slightly over $8.
It had no taste and wasn't even lukewarm.
The chips were old tasting and hard.
Though we arrived about 1130 there was nobody there.
For the half hour that we were there, only a few customers came in for to-go orders.
super.author: Robert J.
super.review:
We had a hankering for burritos and decided to check out the Burrito eater recommendation.  The closest one to our house was this one and we had been to it before.  It was not very memorable, but we decided to go there anyway as we were too lazy to drive very far.  In a summary, the food here is blah which is on par with the service.

I ordered a super burrito and it was slightly over $8.  It had no taste and wasn't even lukewarm. The chips were old tasting and hard. Though we arrived about 1130 there was nobody there.  For the half hour that we were there, only a few customers came in for to-go orders.  Apparently it is not very popular.

The front door was wide open and some black birds flew in.  One of the help had to grab one that was fluttering by the window and tossed it out. Of course, a bunch of its feathers drifted into the restaurant. They didn't bother closing the door which seemed like a no-brainer. The music was turned up way too loud and apparently was meant for the enjoyment of the staff and not the customers.  It was very distracting.

The cashier, a heavy set Hispanic woman, didn't appear to enjoy customers and was unfriendly.  She reminded us of a mannequin in a Halloween mask.  She is definitely a negative impact to this place.

It is unlikely that we will return here.  I would rather go to Chevy's - at least the staff has better customer service skills and the food is warm.

excerpts: I can lie to myself and say that by walking there and back I am burning off some of the calories in a super burrito.
Not for everybody, but good for me.
super.author: Brendon O.
super.review:
A disclaimer: I live about two blocks from this place, AND I hate to drive, so I'll admit that my fourth star has more to do with my laziness/being a somewhat captive audience than about the quality of the food.

Having said that, I think the food here is good.  Not great, but good.  The chile verde pork is quite tasty, and is probably the reason I do not experience the "dry burrito" syndrome several others here have reported.  The salsa bar is also quite good, and my wife really likes the green tomatillo salsa in particular.  

The service...huh.  I go here enough that I am greeted warmly, but they are SLOW.  If there are more than a couple people in line ahead of you, I would recommend a book or placing your order and then running next door for a smoothie, cuz it's gonna be a minute.

Good food, in the neighborhood, and I can lie to myself and say that by walking there and back I am burning off some of the calories in a super burrito.  Not for everybody, but good for me.

excerpts: so i finally get a super carne asada to take home
They were extremely cheap on pretty much everything, even the rice, resulting in a super burrito that was only super in name and price only.
super.author: Ala T.
super.review:
My usual burritos from Gordo's on 9th Ave. or the The New Spot in the Dogpatch. El Beach Burrito is just 3 short blocks from my house so i decided to give it a go as i was hungry, and thought a burrito would do nicely.

My brother and I walk in an notice it is deserted. Strike one. But still my stomach is willing to give it a chance. The lady at the register wasn't friendly in the least. She didn't speak English well, but she apparently felt like we were bugging here just by buying food from her restaurant. Strike Two. Okay so i finally get a super carne asada to take home, it is a little pricey, more than im used to and they charged for using a wheat tortilla. Foul Ball. The money could still be worth it if it's really good.

Nope. Strike Three and El Beach Burrito is out. A dry, flavor-poor burrito is what i got. Also they use a yellow-orange cheese that reminded me of a viscous Kraft Mac and Cheese. They were extremely cheap on pretty much everything, even the rice, resulting in a super burrito that was only super in name and price only. 

Stay away! If you're in the Outer Sunset, make the trip to 9th avenue.

excerpts: Similar to most reviews, bad service, boring, bland food and a lack of interest in pleasing the customer is what you'll get here.  never seen a super burrito that didn't come with cheese, lettuce or less than a spoonful of guac and sour cream.
but that's what they gave me.
overcooked meat and salsa that has less flavor than the safeway brand i had to put it on it to wash it down at home.
all for the low price of $9+.
do NOT go here.
walk across the street to Celia's and pay an extra $2 and be happy.
super.author: Matthew L.
super.review: Similar to most reviews, bad service, boring, bland food and a lack of interest in pleasing the customer is what you'll get here.  never seen a super burrito that didn't come with cheese, lettuce or less than a spoonful of guac and sour cream.  but that's what they gave me.  overcooked meat and salsa that has less flavor than the safeway brand i had to put it on it to wash it down at home.  all for the low price of $9+.  do NOT go here.  walk across the street to Celia's and pay an extra $2 and be happy.

excerpts: My daughter and I liked their nuclear (super big) quesadilla so much, that we went there two straight days in a row.
Its so simple and so delicious.
Thank you Guys!
super.author: Dimitri R.
super.review: My daughter and I liked their nuclear (super big) quesadilla so much, that we went there two straight days in a row. Its so simple and so delicious. Thank you Guys!

excerpts: My girlfriend really likes their super veggie nachos, which has sauteed veggies (zucchini, squash, onions, bell peppers--which are imho a veggie not fit for human consumption
but I digress--
etc)
They're a pretty good deal, though it also depends on which chips they're using.
Sometimes the chips here are good and fresh, sometimes they seem (like some other taquerias) as if they came out of a stale Costco bag.
I think they may even charge extra for chips now?
Which would be worth it if the chips were actually good.
The burritos are hit or miss, have had a decent chicken burrito here but all the ones I've had are lacking a bit of flavor.
Get the chicken verde or another meat with sauce if you can-- the grilled meats are ok but just underflavored.
(Always find myself adding some of their free salsas to the burritos when I bring them home.)
Basically this place will do in a pinch if you live in the neighborhood, but don't expect something close to the best of the Mission.
If you're really seriously jonesing for a high quality burrito or tacos, you can do better.
super.author: Craigary P.
super.review:
About what you'd expect from a place called "El Beach Burrito" located near the, yes, beach. Uncreative, mellow, friendly, casual, not great. It doesn't compare with the best places in the city, in the Mission, or even some better places in Haight and Inner Sunset. The service is anywhere from friendly to spacey/possibly stoned. We've had mixed results from the food: My girlfriend really likes their super veggie nachos, which has sauteed veggies (zucchini, squash, onions, bell peppers--which are imho a veggie not fit for human consumption but I digress--etc) They're a pretty good deal, though it also depends on which chips they're using. Sometimes the chips here are good and fresh, sometimes they seem (like some other taquerias) as if they came out of a stale Costco bag. I think they may even charge extra for chips now? Which would be worth it if the chips were actually good.  The burritos are hit or miss, have had a decent chicken burrito here but all the ones I've had are lacking a bit of flavor. Get the chicken verde or another meat with sauce if you can-- the grilled meats are ok but just underflavored. (Always find myself adding some of their free salsas to the burritos when I bring them home.)  Basically this place will do in a pinch if you live in the neighborhood, but don't expect something close to the best of the Mission. If you're really seriously jonesing for a high quality burrito or tacos, you can do better. (Like Underdog's on Irving/19th.)

But there's no sand or kelp in these "beach" burritos so that's a plus!

excerpts: I recommend the tofu and veggies super burrito.
It was filled to the brim with huge chunks of seared tofu and a veggie medley of squash, onion, pepper, and mushrooms, all of which are my favorites.
When the hombre attempted to roll it, it barely made it, and then he crammed it into a tight foil package.
Upon opening, it oozed out into a surplus of cheesy goodness all over my plate.
I appropriately sopped its innards up with their crunchy chips and topped it with their house made fresh fire roasted salsa, which was very tasty.
super.author: M K.
super.review: Yes I have had better, I have also had worse. This place is convenient and everything is made fresh to order. They also give you a huge helping for a very small price. I recommend the tofu and veggies super burrito. It was filled to the brim with huge chunks of seared tofu and a veggie medley of squash, onion, pepper, and mushrooms, all of which are my favorites. When the hombre attempted to roll it, it barely made it, and then he crammed it into a tight foil package. Upon opening, it oozed out into a surplus of cheesy goodness all over my plate. I appropriately sopped its innards up with their crunchy chips and topped it with their house made fresh fire roasted salsa, which was very tasty.

excerpts: I ordered a super taco, and basically they just piled and bunch of crap on a corn tortilla...which made it impossible to eat in a efficient manner.
super.author: Mario W.
super.review:
The food is WAY OVER PRICED, and lacks flavor.
I wouldn't say the food is disgusting, It's just not very good considering that there are tons of other places in SF were you can get a more authentic taqueria experience for a lower price.

The burritos are OK...the tacos are a joke.
I ordered a super taco, and basically they just piled and bunch of crap on a corn tortilla...which made it impossible to eat in a efficient manner.

The breakfast burrito is actually really good but thats about it.

Oh yeah...really stupid wall paintings with burritos and chili peppers with mustaches wearing hats on the beach...

excerpts: I went right after El Beach Burrito because I had a craving for a Super Burrito...

As I got in and looked at the menu that was posted on the wall so then, I ordered myself a Super Burrito w/ steak on it as, I finished up the super burrito like all the other burrito joints that I have been to...
Now that I have eaten at El Beach Burrito for the first time for lunch I have to say that the super burritos that they make are pretty good and enough for me to get stuffed with a smile!!!
Maybe not everyone will get stuffed with the super burrito that I have just eaten but for me is a yes...
super.author: William B.
super.review: In the beginning I wasnt sure on where to go eat at, I had a choice of going to Mango Medley, Sea Breeze or El Beach Burrito... So I had to pick one of these three places to eat at so then, I made up my mind I went right after El Beach Burrito because I had a craving for a Super Burrito... As I got in and looked at the menu that was posted on the wall so then, I ordered myself a Super Burrito w/ steak on it as, I finished up the super burrito like all the other burrito joints that I have been to... Now that I have eaten at El Beach Burrito for the first time for lunch I have to say that the super burritos that they make are pretty good and enough for me to get stuffed with a smile!!! Maybe not everyone will get stuffed with the super burrito that I have just eaten but for me is a yes...

excerpts: The super burrito looks like too much of a mess.
Viva grilled chicken!
super.author: M. O.
super.review: My favorite burrito in SF. The grilled chicken is great. The salsa bar is very fresh, house made, and tasty, with varying spicyness to choose from. I can't judge the rest of the menu because I am addicted to their grilled chicken regular burrito. The super burrito looks like too much of a mess. Viva grilled chicken!

excerpts: I ordered the pinto bean super and was full afterwards.
Definitely pretty big and filling.
Everyone was nice
and I was served promptly.
No complaints.
super.author: Michael L.
super.review: It was not the best burrito, but it was standard.  I ordered the pinto bean super and was full afterwards.  Definitely pretty big and filling.  Everyone was nice and I was served promptly.  No complaints.

excerpts: Not sure how I feel about the rice, but the pico de gallo is super!
Nothing beats great pico
de gallo
and I admire the salsa selection.
Their chips are enjoyable, just the right amount of salt.
And you get a generous amount of food for under seven dollars, and their sides are enormous.
Five stars for delicious food and friendly service.
Don't forget to tip, they deserve it!
super.author: Queso D.
super.review: Uhmm...NOT the worst Mexican food and NOT overpriced, and NOT bad service. I get the tofu burrito, but I don't know how vegetarian it is, I get a little sketched about them cooking on a grill they might have been cooking meat on. Now I'm not saying that they DO that but I don't know how considerate they are about grilling tofu on a separate and uncontaminated grill. So just keep that in mind if you're getting the tofu, they don't season it but it's SO good. Not sure how I feel about the rice, but the pico de gallo is super! Nothing beats great pico de gallo and I admire the salsa selection. Their chips are enjoyable, just the right amount of salt. And you get a generous amount of food for under seven dollars, and their sides are enormous. Five stars for delicious food and friendly service. Don't forget to tip, they deserve it!

excerpts: Can't say that I didn't enjoy my overwhelmingly huge plate of nachos (super meaty nachos) - topped with grilled chicken (moist, but lacked a bit of flavor), guac, sour cream, black beans (just a tad dry, but the guac and sour cream made up for it) and lettuce.
The BF had a super meaty carnitas burrito.
The carnitas was better flavored than the chicken.
super.author: Teresa Y.
super.review:
We ate, we left, I pooed. 

El Beach Burrito is a pretty decent Mexican place in the outer Sunset. Can't say that I didn't enjoy my overwhelmingly huge plate of nachos (super meaty nachos) - topped with grilled chicken (moist, but lacked a bit of flavor), guac, sour cream, black beans (just a tad dry, but the guac and sour cream made up for it) and lettuce. The amount was more than satisfying.

The BF had a super meaty carnitas burrito. The carnitas was better flavored than the chicken. Packed with rice, black beans, guac, sour cream and, of course, meat, the burrito was hearty and warm to his stummy. 

Downside of this place is the price. For nachos and a burrito, our meal came out to $16. Wow. I don't think I've ever paid that much for Mexican food.... anywhere. Boo for that. For $16, I wish I didn't have to poo right after lunch. Man... now I'm hungry again.

excerpts: and i said, "super carne asada burrito".
She charged me $7.95 or something.
I gave her a $20 bill.
Then five minutes later she asked me again,
"What did you order?
super.author: Nancy M.
super.review:
The  crabby woman who is at the cashier is..like the other guy said, a SPACE CADET. She asked me what did i order and i said, "super carne asada burrito". She charged me $7.95 or something. I gave her a $20 bill. Then five minutes later she asked me again, "What did you order?" 

i said i ordered a burrito then she asked me to pay AGAIN! what the fuck?!? then i said, "I PAID ALREADY. I GAVE YOU MONEY." and she started shaking her head. YO BROAD! i paid your ass already!! ugh.. And i was like are you serious??? 
I JUST PAID YOU 5 MINUTES AGO!!! then she checked her reciepts and realized that i did pay. and i was like, "I gave you a $20 bill and you gave me this amount back" and she still was shaking her head!! 

what a crazy woman!!!! is it cuz im asian and all asians look the same so she couldn't tell?

also, i asked one guy for a side of extra hot sauce (because their burritos are soooo dry!! but shame on me, cuz i keep coming back) and a few moments later, he would ask me again to make sure, "you want hot sauce?!" "uhh. yea?" and never got it.

The funniest thing is, I asked him to put black beans ON THE SIDE. when i got home, i found out he put them in a tiny salsa container (which seriously fits about 10 beans, max). okay fine, whatever. i took a bite of my burrito and taste a whole shit load of black beans in my mouth.  whaaaa, it's inside too??WTF?!? LOL

are you guys fucking with me on purpose or what? cuz if you are......... its working -_-

excerpts: Maybe I'm not the best person to ask, though, because I grew up in Monterey County, where the mexican food is super authentic, super cheap, and super delicious.
I have yet to find mexican food in the city that really wows me (and I've lived here for a year and a half
and, yes, I have tried all over the mission).
So, for SF standards, this place gets four stars-- an overall average place.
Clean, decent food, average prices.
super.author: Christina M.
super.review: This place is good but not really awesome. Maybe I'm not the best person to ask, though, because I grew up in Monterey County, where the mexican food is super authentic, super cheap, and super delicious. I have yet to find mexican food in the city that really wows me (and I've lived here for a year and a half and, yes, I have tried all over the mission). So, for SF standards, this place gets four stars-- an overall average place. Clean, decent food, average prices.

excerpts: I think their vegetarian super burrito is surprisingly flavorful--and always warm, unlike most other taquerias.
super.author: Kandi K.
super.review:
I am cool with El Beach Burrito.  It certainly satisfies when in need of a burrito.  I don't think anything in the Mission is a whole lot better.  I grew up in the City and have eaten plenty of burritos from various taquerias in the Mission.  I think their vegetarian super burrito is surprisingly flavorful--and always warm, unlike most other taquerias.  

I can't really understand why anyone would say their burritos have no flavor.  They have chicken in a red sauce, tomatillo sauce, as well as grilled and all of them are tasty and very different from each other.  Their mojado sauce is some of the best.  It definitely tastes homemade.  My dad and both of my brothers love it.

I do think the food is overpriced, but I'll pay the extra $1 to have something this close to where I live.

As for the service, they are not overly friendly, but who cares?  As long as they don't spit in my food, I'm cool with an $8 meal.

excerpts: Everything is super-salty.
Yuck!
super.author: T M.
super.review: I used to love this place a couple of years ago. It's the only n'hood burrito eatery near the beach and they used to make decent burritos/tacos (I would've given them 3 stars).  The food and service has totally gone downhill the past few months.  Everything is super-salty.  Yuck!

excerpts: That's all I get, Super pork burrito!
Oh actually I have gotten nachos there too
, they were good.
I rather walk an extra 5 blocks to come here than one block to the other taqueria near my place.
You Outter sunseters know where I'm talking about.
super.author: Karen T.
super.review: I live near here so I go here. Their pork is very moist! That's all I get, Super pork burrito! Oh actually I have gotten nachos there too, they were good. I rather walk an extra 5 blocks to come here than one block to the other taqueria near my place. You Outter sunseters know where I'm talking about.

excerpts: The Super Veggie Burrito consists of cheese, beans,rice and lettuce.
Not very "super veggie" since it only had one vegetable!
Lame.
Salsa has a very odd taste.
It is a very clean place though.
Also, the main reason for 1 instead of 2 stars: While ordering I received at least 5 eye rolls and 2 sighs from the waitress.
Horrible customer service.
super.author: Tara M.
super.review:
My first time there and I was NOT impressed. The Super Veggie Burrito consists of cheese, beans,rice and lettuce. Not very "super veggie" since it only had one vegetable!  Lame.
Salsa has a very odd taste. 
It is a very clean place though.
Also, the main reason for 1 instead of 2 stars: While ordering I received at least 5 eye rolls and 2 sighs from the waitress. Horrible customer service.

excerpts: I wanted a rice and bean burrito which is $3.50 or $3.75 (not too sure) and then make it "super" which is an extra $1.50 for cheese, sour cream and salsa added on.
They kept telling us to buy a super veggie burrito cause its the same thing
and we were debating back and forth until finally we got what we wanted but still ended up getting charged for a super veggie burrito.
Too bad.
It'd be nice to have a decent local place to grab  food to go when you're in a hurry.
super.author: Michelle B.
super.review: Sorry guys, I don't like giving negative reviews but after taking a couple of bites out of a rice and bean burrito with sour cream, cheese and salsa my stomach was tied up in knots for a few hours. The two guys working there didn't seem to understand their own menu. I wanted a rice and bean burrito which is $3.50 or $3.75 (not too sure) and then make it "super" which is an extra $1.50 for cheese, sour cream and salsa added on. They kept telling us to buy a super veggie burrito cause its the same thing and we were debating back and forth until finally we got what we wanted but still ended up getting charged for a super veggie burrito. Too bad. It'd be nice to have a decent local place to grab  food to go when you're in a hurry.

excerpts: I purchased a super burrito with carnitas and black beans that was enough to fill me up and leave me with a massive food baby.
The burrito wasn't super salty which is usually a problem when I eat food like this.
$9 well spent!
super.author: Megan S.
super.review: For a quick and huge burrito, the ones here are fantastic. I purchased a super burrito with carnitas and black beans that was enough to fill me up and leave me with a massive food baby. The burrito wasn't super salty which is usually a problem when I eat food like this. $9 well spent!

excerpts: Thier Super Tacos are my addiction.
super.author: Bin M.
super.review: I love this place... correction, I crave this place.  Thier Super Tacos are my addiction.

excerpts: I enjoy the super veggie burrito, but the service is horrible.
They're slow and a bit rude.
The salsa bar is not great and the other burritos are okay.
A little overpriced for what it really is.
super.author: Kate S.
super.review: I enjoy the super veggie burrito, but the service is horrible.  They're slow and a bit rude.  The salsa bar is not great and the other burritos are okay.  A little overpriced for what it really is.  Nothing special, but if you live near there I recommend calling in your order first.

excerpts: I usually get the Super Carnitas Burrito, that's been my thing lately.
The place is clean, the staff is pleasant and quick, the salsa bar has great red and green options.
If you are looking for some dependable grubbing while out at the beach, hit this place up.
super.author: Sean S.
super.review: We all know that the Mission has some tasty mexican food, but I have to say that El Beach Burrito is an amazing establishment and a shining beacon in the fog of the Outer Sunset.  I usually get the Super Carnitas Burrito, that's been my thing lately.  The place is clean, the staff is pleasant and quick, the salsa bar has great red and green options.  If you are looking for some dependable grubbing while out at the beach, hit this place up.

excerpts: After a couple hours walking around on the beach, I can go up here and down a super veggie burrito.
And that's all I'll ever need to order here.
I can't speak for the other items on the menu, but that's one thing that they do right.
super.author: eh k.
super.review: Going to the beach makes me so hungry.  I've been trying to let go of the craving for bologna and cheese sandwiches left over from too many childhood beach picnics, and this place is helping me get through.  After a couple hours walking around on the beach, I can go up here and down a super veggie burrito.  And that's all I'll ever need to order here.  I can't speak for the other items on the menu, but that's one thing that they do right.

excerpts: My boyfriend says I have a special talent for finding hairs in my food.
I think he's a little embarrassed at how often I complain about it.
Well... today was one of those days.
Once I sat down with the new bag of chips, I dipped into my nachos and... pulled a hair out!
It was buried quite deep, but was short and blonde.
(FMcF had long black hair.
Let's give FMcF the benefit of the doubt and not make this dining experience any worse.)
So I picked out the hair and tossed the contaminated bite to the dog.
When I finally mustered the strength for a second bite...
I found a SECOND HAIR.
A SECOND HAIR BURIED EVEN DEEPER THAN THE FIRST.
I presented my furry dish to FMcF, expressing my distaste.
She initially refused to believe me, insisting she didn't see it.
Then she offered "MAYBE IT WAS ON THE FORK".
I showed her the hair was buried, I insisted this was the second one I found in my dish, and get this, FMcF said "YEAH
I GET IT.
YOU'RE TRYING TO COMPLAIN..
WHAT DO YOU WANT ME TO DO...
REMAKE IT?"
First of all, the hair was definitely embedded in the food.
Second of all, why would hair growing on your forks be any better?
special.author: Arielle C.
special.review:
El Beach Burrito? How about El B*tch Burrito. I would give this place ZERO STARS if possible. Between the restaurant layout, the food, and especially the service, this IS ABSOLUTELY the WORST dining experience I have ever had...

1. Didn't know where to order or pay
The only indicator of where this restaurant's overhead menu is is Frowny McFrownster (FMcF) half waving at the confused would-be (but shouldn't-be) customers. (Is she saying 'hi' to me? Is she telling me to go away? Oh, she's telling me the menu is in the way back where she's standing!) Even then, the menu was shrouded behind cooking vents in the furthest corner of the restaurant, and had more pages than there were TV screens - a perfect example of where technology does more harm than good. (Wait... still can't find the menu. Oh! There it is! I think I want the burrito, no, the nachos, no the tacos, wait... what were my options again? I guess I'll wait for the slide show to start again...)

2. Soggy flavorless food
I ordered the nachos, because you can never mess up nachos, right?! WRONG. There were not enough (stale Costco) chips. There was but one layer of sad (not toasted) chips, struggling under the weight of the watery beans and chicken (and NO CHEESE). 
My meal was so sadly flavorless, the food was crying, and the only thing to mop its tears were the thin layer of tortilla chips. 
I tried so hard to comfort my sad meal, my natural solution was to ask for more more chips! (Chips are usually free for dine-in Mexican places any how, right? Besides they're at the counter, with tongs, and bags, within arms reach of the customer). So I go inside for more chips and FMcF immediately snaps at me "THEY'RE NOT FREE". So I give my eye-rolling server the $1.10 for the small bag of chips, which contained just as many chips as my original $12 plate of sorrowful nachos did.

3. Found hair in my food - correction: HAIRS
My boyfriend says I have a special talent for finding hairs in my food. I think he's a little embarrassed at how often I complain about it. Well... today was one of those days. Once I sat down with the new bag of chips, I dipped into my nachos and... pulled a hair out! It was buried quite deep, but was short and blonde. (FMcF had long black hair. Let's give FMcF the benefit of the doubt and not make this dining experience any worse.) So I picked out the hair and tossed the contaminated bite to the dog. When I finally mustered the strength for a second bite... I found a SECOND HAIR. A SECOND HAIR BURIED EVEN DEEPER THAN THE FIRST.  I presented my furry dish to FMcF, expressing my distaste.  She initially refused to believe me, insisting she didn't see it. Then she offered "MAYBE IT WAS ON THE FORK". I showed her the hair was buried, I insisted this was the second one I found in my dish, and get this, FMcF said "YEAH I GET IT. YOU'RE TRYING TO COMPLAIN.. WHAT DO YOU WANT ME TO DO... REMAKE IT?" First of all, the hair was definitely embedded in the food. Second of all, why would hair growing on your forks be any better? Hair should not be floating around (or be buried) in the food you serve. 

In the end, I was too upset to wait for them to remake my nachos, especially after being asked detailed questions about what I ordered (sorry, not sorry, but I was upset enough as it was and FMcF could have safely deduced my order by looking at my untouched plate). I walked away. My only regret is not asking for a refund first. Actually, my regret is not taking a hint from the lack of traffic and making the mistake of walking into El B*tch Burrito at all!

IN CONCLUSION. Do not mistake this places's cleanliness for godliness. The fact this place LOOKS clean is because there's no mess to pick up! People aren't going here because they don't want  Mexican food by the beach. They aren't coming here because no one likes Mexican food that tastes more flavorless than the cafeteria lady's leftover surprise. But hey, at least the cafeteria lady wears a hairnet.

excerpts: The bf said his dish was a substantial amount of food (a whole platter of stuff AND a basket of chips + tortillas), but nothing special.
special.author: Miss H.
special.review:
So one of my besties SWEARS by this place, and I finally tried it... and I have to say, El Burrito Express on Taraval will always have my heart (and stomach!). I got the super carne asada quesadilla and horchata, and the bf got the huevos... mexicana? something. I thought my quesadilla was ok - a little too much sour cream and I felt like the flavors just weren't there. The horchata was suuuper cinnamon-y and sweet. The bf said his dish was a substantial amount of food (a whole platter of stuff AND a basket of chips + tortillas), but nothing special.

I will say though, that this burrito joint is definitely more spacious and cleaner than the typical and one of the few places to dine at in the area!

excerpts: I ordered the special burrito w/ chicken & black beans.
It included guac & cheese.
Honestly, there was nothing special about it.
I could only eat half until I felt sick to my stomach.
Mind you, there was no taste whatsoever to this burrito.
If I had closed my eyes, I probably could not identify what the hell I just ate.
I was greatly disappointed.
But hey, at least I left feeling really bloated in the most satisfying sense that I'm no longer hungry.
Don't come here.
Seriously, don't.
special.author: Ash Y.
special.review: Jeeesus, no. Even if you're hungry, don't come here. Service was mediocre. They don't seem to care really about offering quality service as seen from their sullen faces. Place was pretty much empty when we sat down. That was already a sign. Still, all the other places that were "good" were packed to the point there were people lining up outside. Paid $8 for a sizable portion. I ordered the special burrito w/ chicken & black beans. It included guac & cheese. Honestly, there was nothing special about it. I could only eat half until I felt sick to my stomach. Mind you, there was no taste whatsoever to this burrito. If I had closed my eyes, I probably could not identify what the hell I just ate. I was greatly disappointed. But hey, at least I left feeling really bloated in the most satisfying sense that I'm no longer hungry. Don't come here. Seriously, don't.

excerpts: I normally get the special burrito with chicken, and it comes out to $8.70 without the chips.
special.author: Friendly R.
special.review:
Though I've been checking Yelp for a while, I didn't make an account until now. But the reviews for this place warrant it!

I find the food to be quite good quality, and eat here almost every day because of it. I normally get the special burrito with chicken, and it comes out to $8.70 without the chips. Now $8.70 isn't exactly a steal, but they certainly don't skimp on size.

Customer service through my experience has been great, they are all friendly people and remember my order and make pleasant conversation in the downtime. Though I definitely have had to stand around for about a minute waiting for an attendant, they make the food pretty quickly once ordered. If it tastes bland (which I agree it will if you don't ask for salsa or hot sauce) grab some salsa verde which is supplied free at the salsa bar. It's delicious.

One star taken away because I have definitely had my stomach feeling weird on two occasions, once with some actual pain. But compared to the amount of times I have ate there total, it doesn't make me stop going.

excerpts: I had the special burrito w/ spicy chicken and it did the job.
I'm full and still have the lingering flavor of guacamole and picante in my mouth
special.author: scott w.
special.review:
If you live in the Mission click away from this page. If you live in the Mission and you find yourself here go home. Pick up your PBR, hop on your track bike and head back. You can find your way by jumping on the N or just following what smells to be a mix of Taqueria and Urine.

Let's face it. In Sunset we don't have many options for Mexican and sometimes you really want some with out travelling too far out of your way. For that, I give this place 2 stars. It gets another star for being able to lean your bike up outside and not have to worry about it getting stolen or thrown up on as you would in the aforementioned Mission. But yes, if you have the time I would make the effort to go out to Papalote.

I had the special burrito w/ spicy chicken and it did the job. I'm full and still have the lingering flavor of guacamole and picante in my mouth so I can't complain.

If mediocrity was to take the form of Mexican food it would be a burrito from El Beach.

excerpts: I got a special chicken burrito that was not too special at all.
In fact it was a un special chicken burrito.
The only reason this place got two stars was because the bathroom was so clean.
They must have just cleaned it.
I swear it was the cleanest bathroom in a mexican joint I have seen and everybody knows that i love bathrooms in mexican joints...
So to sum it up don't eat here
but if you have to take a dump you know where to go....
special.author: Tito C.
special.review: So as I was driving through the sunset to get to the lower haight and I told my friends about this place that makes a great rio bowl.  So with a little convincing that I was not a hippie we ended up at Judahlicious.  But it was closed.  MFer.  I got a special chicken burrito that was not too special at all.  In fact it was a un special chicken burrito.  The only reason this place got two stars was because the bathroom was so clean.  They must have just cleaned it.  I swear it was the cleanest bathroom in a mexican joint I have seen and everybody knows that i love bathrooms in mexican joints...  So to sum it up don't eat here but if you have to take a dump you know where to go....

excerpts: Nothing special, but
if you live near there I recommend calling in your order first.
special.author: Kate S.
special.review: I enjoy the super veggie burrito, but the service is horrible.  They're slow and a bit rude.  The salsa bar is not great and the other burritos are okay.  A little overpriced for what it really is.  Nothing special, but if you live near there I recommend calling in your order first.

excerpts: I usually order the steak and prawn quesadilla which are pretty good besides the fact they're usually drenched in oil.
I tried the carne asada nachos for the first time, and it didn't meet my expectations at all..
I was hoping for nachos with large amounts of toppings like most other places, but it fell short.
There wasn't much flavor either, it was pretty bland...
The steak and prawn quesadilla, carne asada nachos and drinks came out to $24..
Maybe I'm trippin but for a high price
, I feel like we should have gotten a bigger portion, more bang for our buck.
3 stars for the convenience because it's right next to ocean beach, if anything I would only recommend the steak and prawn quesadilla.
Just bring a lot of napkins!
prawn.author: Cassie T.
prawn.review:
TL;DR: pretty expensive joint for mediocre-decent food that you can get much cheaper and better somewhere else.

I sometimes come here right before going to the beach since it's so close, but my trips will probably be coming to an end. I usually order the steak and prawn quesadilla which are pretty good besides the fact they're usually drenched in oil. I tried the carne asada nachos for the first time, and it didn't meet my expectations at all.. I was hoping for nachos with large amounts of toppings like most other places, but it fell short. There wasn't much flavor either, it was pretty bland... The steak and prawn quesadilla, carne asada nachos and drinks came out to $24.. Maybe I'm trippin but for a high price, I feel like we should have gotten a bigger portion, more bang for our buck. 3 stars for the convenience because it's right next to ocean beach, if anything I would only recommend the steak and prawn quesadilla. Just bring a lot of napkins!

excerpts: On a second visit I got the Prawn Burrito.
prawn.author: Olivia B.
prawn.review:
Ate here once out of a desperate craving for a burrito and no patience to travel inbound to the Mission.
Definitely, not a Mission burrito, but the best taqueria I've hit out in these parts of town! (If you're in the Outer Richmond I would go to Chino's).

I got the Super Chicken burrito and the portion size was hefty! Flavorful and perfectly made.
On a second visit I got the Prawn Burrito. It was a bit too salty for my liking.

Things to note:
- Homemade salsa bar
- Must pay for Chips
- Lots of seating inside, but also some outdoor seating for those rare sunny Outer Sunset days

excerpts: The prawn burrito is awesome as well.
Yummmmmmm.
prawn.author: Julianne M.
prawn.review: One of my favorite veggie burritos in SF, especially awesome since you can grab it to go an head to the beach! The prawn burrito is awesome as well. Yummmmmmm.

excerpts: a beans and rice burrito, a tofu burrito, a fish burrito, a prawn burrito, and my favorite, the chile relleno burrito.
prawn.author: Alison Y.
prawn.review:
Okay, let's just start off by stating the obvious: no, this is not a place in the Mission. However, it is one of a very few Mexican places in the outer sunset, and I have found that El Beach Burrito far outshines their neighborhood competition.

1. Lots of choices, especially if you don't eat very many meat products. I am mainly vegetarian but occasionally eat fish, and this place has OPTIONS!:  a veggie burrito, a grilled vegetables burrito, a beans and rice burrito, a tofu burrito, a fish burrito, a prawn burrito, and my favorite, the chile relleno burrito.

2. Decent size and not horribly expensive. Yes, you pay $1.50 more for a 'super' burrito, but even the regular burritos are large. Plus they give you a decent amount of chips and you can take as much salsa as you'd like from their salsa bar.

3. Friendly staff. The two guys who run the cash register have always been super nice and happy. Even the cook staff has always been smiling when I'm in there.

Those three things alone make this a far preferable option (in my opinion) than La Playa on Noriega. Plus I like the flavors of their burritos far more as well.

excerpts: She didn't know what was in the grilled vegetable burrito.
She said "um, mushrooms.
When I finally set my order for pickup later on and asked what the final price was, she said "we'll calculate it when you get here.
grilled vegetable.author: Carleen W.
grilled vegetable.review:
I only ordered takeout from here...

I called in to ask about some of the burritos and a young girl answered who had no real clue. She didn't know what was in the grilled vegetable burrito. She said "um, mushrooms." When I finally set my order for pickup later on and asked what the final price was, she said "we'll calculate it when you get here." How... unaccommodating.

The food leans more toward the bad side. Doesn't have much flavor and not very authentic.

The worst part is that there was a rock in my burrito! A rock!!! The size of my pinky nail! Thank god I'm not a very hard chewer or I would've chipped a damn tooth!

excerpts: The horchata drink is perfect, the super vegetarian burrito is pretty good, and I don't like too much else.
super vegetarian.author: Deanna K.
super vegetarian.review:
That's right, just A-OK. 

The horchata drink is perfect, the super vegetarian burrito is pretty good, and I don't like too much else.

excerpts: She communicates this to the high af cook who throws two tiny corn tortillas on the grill.
They start talking in Spanish
and I catch a few words including "cochina".
I open them up and they're literally corn tortilla + a bit of meat
corn.author: Allison O.
corn.review:
The people are terrible, and the food is terrible.

There is no menu when I walk in. The lady is extremely rude in asking what I want so I ask if they have tacos. She communicates this to the high af cook who throws two tiny corn tortillas on the grill. They start talking in Spanish and I catch a few words including "cochina". Google it.

I stand there awkwardly until they're done then go to pay, and she gives no instructions on where to put my card or a price. Turns out to be over $10 for these two tiny "tacos". I open them up and they're literally corn tortilla + a bit of meat + some chopped tomatoes.

Will not be going back here.

excerpts: There was nothing Mexican about the entire flavor except for the fact that it was served on a piece of corn tortilla topped with slightly salted beans and tomatoes that seemed to have been treated to resemble salsa.
corn.author: Shinta L.
corn.review: The worst mexican food I have ever had. Overpriced too. I ordered fish taco and shrimp taco. It was bland. The fish was just seasoned with salt and pepper (andddd under-seasoned). Not even a drop of spice unique to mexican food was there. There was nothing Mexican about the entire flavor except for the fact that it was served on a piece of corn tortilla topped with slightly salted beans and tomatoes that seemed to have been treated to resemble salsa. Shrimp taco is same treatment. Let's move to the homemade salsa bar. WORST salsas ever. No flavor, lack or no seasonings. The entire meal was a waste of money.

excerpts: I ordered a super taco, and basically they just piled and bunch of crap on a corn tortilla...which made it impossible to eat in a efficient manner.
corn.author: Mario W.
corn.review:
The food is WAY OVER PRICED, and lacks flavor.
I wouldn't say the food is disgusting, It's just not very good considering that there are tons of other places in SF were you can get a more authentic taqueria experience for a lower price.

The burritos are OK...the tacos are a joke.
I ordered a super taco, and basically they just piled and bunch of crap on a corn tortilla...which made it impossible to eat in a efficient manner.

The breakfast burrito is actually really good but thats about it.

Oh yeah...really stupid wall paintings with burritos and chili peppers with mustaches wearing hats on the beach...

excerpts: large chunks of fresh grilled mahi mahi on corn tortillas with chunky "fresh" salsa fresca.
the entire facility is clean and well lit.
corn.author: Playa A.
corn.review:
i have only had the fish tacos there and i think they are very good. large chunks of fresh grilled mahi mahi on corn tortillas with chunky "fresh" salsa fresca.  the entire facility is clean and well lit. the salsa bar has a decent selection of very fresh choices.

the kitchen staff doesn't use lard but does use NON-hydrogenated veggie oil to prepare all there dishes.   when i asked about the oils they happily addressed all of my questions with a smile. 

6  visits and counting

excerpts: but I rather go to taco bell than this place.
taco.author: Mike F.
taco.review: This place sucks.. I was at the beach and looked up Mexican food in the area.. I wish I would of looked them up on Yelp first. The food  had no flavor.  Just alot of pepper.   But no real flover. The lady was rude. I'm a new customer.. she acted like she was too good to be taking orders. And the cook is a joke., rude and yelling at  customers. while having a conversation on his phone.   I like to support locals. but I rather go to taco bell than this place.

excerpts: $5.95 shrimp taco wasn't worth paying more than $1.50, $1.75 tops.
taco.author: M F.
taco.review:
Friends warned us.

Only thing super about my $10.75 "Super Meat Quesadilla" was that it was SUPER overpriced. All sour cream & lettuce; barely any cheese; and carne asada was like teeny-tiny rabbit poop pellets.

$5.95 shrimp taco wasn't worth paying more than $1.50, $1.75 tops.

$8.45 "Meat Burrito" was just rice and beans. No flavor. Shouldn't have paid more than $4.

Damn. $37 waste on bad food and lazy service when you see her sitting down at the counter by the window & he's sitting on the stairs looking at his cell. Heaven forbid they wipe down the tables & push in the chairs. That's what customers are for, right?
