excerpts: I should have known better than to try Mexican when I live in SD which is known for its taco shops, but we were on vacation
and I wanted to live dangerously.
taco.author: Jennifer P.
taco.review:
We ate here after getting off the MUNI, arriving in town to start our vacation.  We tried to go to Outlanders but they seated multiple tables before us (I assume because we had suitcases and requested an outdoor table).

I should have known better than to try Mexican when I live in SD which is known for its taco shops, but we were on vacation and I wanted to live dangerously.  We ordered the super nachos to split.  It was annoying trying to order as the menu is on TVs and it changed screens every so many seconds.  

When we went to order the super nachos the person taking the order did not know what they were and looked confused.  I pointed to the menu and the other person working there explained to them what it was, which apparently is carne aside (maybe just beef) beans, lettuce, pico, sour cream and guacamole.  

The meat was not very flavorful, nor the beans.  The chips were nice and crisp.  They had a salsa bar and I tried the spicy salsa and the green chiles salsa.  The green chiles salsa had almost no taste and was watery.  The spicy was not very spicy.  

Overall it was a disappointing experience.  The restaurant was not busy when we were there )2 other tables full) had 2 employees working and there were dirty unbussed tables in the dining room.  Also lots of flies in the restaurant which may have been because the front doors were left open and it was close to the beach, but not appetizing when dining.

excerpts: I'm getting the best fish or steak, and not Taco Bell quality Mexican food.
taco.author: Brittany R.
taco.review: Quality place owned by a quality native San Franciscan.  They use the best meat - legit, high end stuff (even their tofu!).  I'm happy to pay a little more knowing I'm getting the best fish or steak, and not Taco Bell quality Mexican food.

excerpts: My "super taco" was $5 and it didn't even come with chips.
My taco was mostly sour cream with a little bit of beef.
taco.author: Andrew V.
taco.review:
Overpriced!!! In all seriousness, Mexican food is one of the cheapest types of food to order. San Francisco offers dozens of affordable/tasty dining choices. 

My "super taco" was $5 and it didn't even come with chips. My taco was mostly sour cream with a little bit of beef. I was disappointed. 

The only reason I went here was because, I was waiting for my smoothie next door @ Judalicious. I won't be back!! Damn cheapies... #bye #nothankyou

excerpts: One taco for $5.
Filled me up.
Clean and good food.
Lightly seasoned.
Add your own choices of salsas.
taco.author: Frank Harmony T.
taco.review: Relaxed atmosphere. Fresh food. One taco for $5. Filled me up. Clean and good food. Lightly seasoned. Add your own choices of salsas.

excerpts: This place is incredible - granted, it's probably not as authentic as some "taco shop" in SD, but for where it is, el beach burrito brings the flavor.
A little expensive, but worth the price.
Their carnitas are always juicy and never fatty.
Their portions are generous and their guacamole is so fresh - I could eat here every day.
taco.author: Angela D.
taco.review: This place is incredible - granted, it's probably not as authentic as some "taco shop" in SD, but for where it is, el beach burrito brings the flavor. A little expensive, but worth the price. Their carnitas are always juicy and never fatty. Their portions are generous and their guacamole is so fresh - I could eat here every day.

excerpts: Every time we go here I feel I could've made a better burrito/taco at home, plus it doesn't help that their prices are higher than your usual burrito spots.
taco.author: Frances R.
taco.review: Two words: Overpriced and mediocre. Such a shame because this is the closest burrito place to our house and it isn't good at all. Every time we go here I feel I could've made a better burrito/taco at home, plus it doesn't help that their prices are higher than your usual burrito spots.

excerpts: Del Taco would give more meat attention Elvira really went above and beyond to make the matter right.
She was a stellar employee who turned the situation around.
I went into the call back inquiry full well knowing that the poor workers are thinking they did something wrong
but I was very impressed by Elvira diffusal of the situation.
Elvira kudos to you for keeping me as a well tipping and appreciative customer however to the Owner:
Shame on you sir for being so Barato with the meat.
You run an upscale spot in a upper class area.
People don't want to be nickel and dimed for free chips otherwise elsewhere
but they sure as hell dont want to find out the misleading and seemingly cheatfull formula you enforce to squeeze a dollar more from each so called valued customer.
My advice for what it's worth: is give people what they pay for at the very least.
And if you want to stand out- make sure that your customer takes note of how generous the portions are.
Establish a Rapport with your clientele and then you establish repeat business and free marketing when they blab to their friends how amazing their fav burrito spot is.

You should lower your own pay and give your workers a raise for dealing with insightful shoppers who feel cheated, because apparently Elvira told us that unfortunately those kinds of complaints happen on the daily.
Elvira has convinced me to come again.
I hope to enjoy my food their one day and save the extra hour from having to go back and make a case.
Good day sir and buena suerte.
taco.author: Victor H.
taco.review: After spending 30 dollars on two burritos and some extras I was really looking forward to a hearty steak burrito in the Set with a good friend.  After a charge for chips and salsa were added to the total I reluctantly still tipped 3 bucks in the tip jar thinking well hey its not the workers who make the prices up so why should I sub the cost of the  chip money out of the workers tips that I'm donating, especially for something ALL Mexican places practically smother you in as a mini snack to eat before the awesome authentic taste that comes along with spices and meats such as Asada, Barbacoa, Tripas and so forth....SF Burrito Joints have to offer.   Trekking back through a 10block hike through the Sunset I finally get to chomping my eagerly awaited Asada Super Burrito.  5 bites in realize I haven't hit any meat. 6 bites in I started questioning the Burrito and if they accidentally gave me some hippi vegan burrito by mistake. No mistake as the manager Elvira explained to me... The owner enforces a strict one scoop policy on all super burritos. Enraged for not spending 30 dollars on some burritos Del Taco would give more meat attention Elvira really went above and beyond to make the matter right. She was a stellar employee who turned the situation around.  I went into the call back inquiry full well knowing that the poor workers are thinking they did something wrong but I was very impressed by Elvira diffusal of the situation.  Elvira kudos to you for keeping me as a well tipping and appreciative customer however to the Owner: Shame on you sir for being so Barato with the meat.  You run an upscale spot in a upper class area. People don't want to be nickel and dimed for free chips otherwise elsewhere but they sure as hell dont want to find out the misleading and seemingly cheatfull formula you enforce to squeeze a dollar more from each so called valued customer.  My advice for what it's worth: is give people what they pay for at the very least. And if you want to stand out- make sure that your customer takes note of how generous the portions are. Establish a Rapport with your clientele and then you establish repeat business and free marketing when they blab to their friends how amazing their fav burrito spot is.  You should lower your own pay and give your workers a raise for dealing with insightful shoppers who feel cheated, because apparently Elvira told us that unfortunately those kinds of complaints happen on the daily.   Elvira has convinced me to come again. I hope to enjoy my food their one day and save the extra hour from having to go back and make a case.  Good day sir and buena suerte.

excerpts: After 5 tries I think I wont be returning, but if you are looking for something less appealing than taco bell, El Beach Burrito is the place for you!
taco.author: Nelson S.
taco.review:
This is easily the most flavorless mexican food I have ever had. I've been here a few times and have regretted it every time. Somewhere deep down inside those mediocre burritos is a hint of taste, though I couldnt tell you what that taste is. 
The prices are way too high. Portion size changes with every burrito, sometimes its HUGE, others(more often) its a teeny tiny disgrace.

 After 5 tries I think I wont be returning, but if you are looking for something less appealing than taco bell, El Beach Burrito is the place for you!

excerpts: My mom and I are DEATHLY allergic to dairy, and they put sour cream on her taco, even though she did not ask for it!
taco.author: Lia R.
taco.review:
This is the WORST burrito place I have EVER been to!
 Dear future customers,
 DO NOT EVER go to this burrito place. 
It has horrible service, is WAY TOO expensive , the food is flavorless, and they assume if you don't order something straight up , they give it to you anyway. My mom and I are DEATHLY allergic to dairy, and they put sour cream on her taco, even though she did not ask for it!
All in all this place gets NO STARS, not even one!

Edited to add: This review was actually written by my 10 year old daughter.

excerpts: but it's a quick fix for a taco if you don't want to go all the way to the mission.

taco.review: 3.5 stars. I got an egg dish that was a little bland but it was a lot of food for the money which was nice. The guy was nice as well but the girl at the cash register was taking her sweet time about everything. My boyfriend got the steak tacos which were actually quite delicious. Definitely not the best Mexican food but it's a quick fix for a taco if you don't want to go all the way to the mission.

taco.review: There stuff is pretty good; definitely the best taqueria in the outer sunset.  Like the chile verde chicken a lot, and that is a meat that not a lot of taquerias have.  Basic taco shop food, but tasty and the portions are large.

excerpts: me coming from So Cal with all the taco joints down there

sweet spot!  if im not getting chicken tiki masala after a night of drinking than im prolly here getting a burrito...  they have good choices and im pretty fond of the fish burrito myself... its cheaper than most the others and really good... 

me coming from So Cal with all the taco joints down there I have to say I was pretty stoked to find this spot when I did!  Highly recommend it...

excerpts: I got the super burrito with spicy chicken and my boyfriend got the quesadilla with carnitas.
Both were a lot better than we thought!
spicy chicken.author: Marissa C.
spicy chicken.review:
We wanted acai bowls at the store next door, when they ran out of acai we decided to leave to find food elsewhere and decided to give this place a try. 

I got the super burrito with spicy chicken and my boyfriend got the quesadilla with carnitas. Both were a lot better than we thought! Theres a sauce bar with salsas and jalapenos. I would come back if in the area again.

excerpts: 3 stars for their tasty spicy chicken burrito, friendly service and easy parking on a weekday.
Minus 2 stars for a warm Jarritos from the fridge and charging extra for chips.
spicy chicken.author: Katherine S.
spicy chicken.review: 3 stars for their tasty spicy chicken burrito, friendly service and easy parking on a weekday. Minus 2 stars for a warm Jarritos from the fridge and charging extra for chips.

excerpts: I had the special burrito w/ spicy chicken and it did the job.
I'm full and still have the lingering flavor of guacamole and picante in my mouth
spicy chicken.author: scott w.
spicy chicken.review:
If you live in the Mission click away from this page. If you live in the Mission and you find yourself here go home. Pick up your PBR, hop on your track bike and head back. You can find your way by jumping on the N or just following what smells to be a mix of Taqueria and Urine.

Let's face it. In Sunset we don't have many options for Mexican and sometimes you really want some with out travelling too far out of your way. For that, I give this place 2 stars. It gets another star for being able to lean your bike up outside and not have to worry about it getting stolen or thrown up on as you would in the aforementioned Mission. But yes, if you have the time I would make the effort to go out to Papalote.

I had the special burrito w/ spicy chicken and it did the job. I'm full and still have the lingering flavor of guacamole and picante in my mouth so I can't complain.

If mediocrity was to take the form of Mexican food it would be a burrito from El Beach.

excerpts: Really I give this place 2.5 stars but I am rounding up because the spicy chicken is pretty good (while not being discernibly "spicy") and the basic burrito ingredients are all in place.
spicy chicken.author: Trav W.
spicy chicken.review:
Really I give this place 2.5 stars but I am rounding up because the spicy chicken is pretty good (while not being discernibly "spicy") and the basic burrito ingredients are all in place. A couple of big "buts" (which I like, and I cannot lie)...

I asked for no guacamole (I know this takes some of you aback. Get off my back you judgmental avocado snobs), and I got home to find a rather large dollop of it smeared strategically mid-burrito. There are like five ingredients in a burrito and I saw them write down "no guac" when I said it. I was literally the only person in line at the time, busyness was a non-factor. I suppose I should be congratulating them for fucking up something so difficult to fuck up. Congrats, El Beach Burrito (do they really need the "El" in their name?).

Also the roll of the burrito was poorly executed. Way too loose, which left the burrito with a huge lengthwise crack running down it where the two sides of the tortilla didn't meet. All the juices from the chicken/beans/salsa ran out of the crack, and the result was me trying to eat something akin to a large wet bag. A pretty tasty bag though, I will concede. Kind of shitty horchata, the second half of the cup was really gritty like they actually made it AT the beach. I guess I should have known something was amiss at this taqueria when I saw a white person working there.

excerpts: I ordered the grilled tofu burrito.
There was rice, black beans and grilled tofu.
I added some salsa from the tasty salsa bar.
The service was fast, the food fresh and delicious.
I had my reservations ordering grilled tofu from a burrito place
but I was pleasantly surprised!
I'll be back!
grilled tofu.author: Diana M.
grilled tofu.review: I ordered the grilled tofu burrito. There was rice, black beans and grilled tofu.  I added some salsa from the tasty salsa bar.  The service was fast, the food fresh and delicious.  I had my reservations ordering grilled tofu from a burrito place but I was pleasantly surprised!  I'll be back!

excerpts: So you can imagine, that when I got my very well priced slab featuring a wheat tortilla absolutely jammed with grilled tofu, black beans and mild sauce I went to town.
grilled tofu.author: Jason B.
grilled tofu.review:
An epic show. An epic run. An epic burrito.

I'm pretty sure I know why this burrito was so good. I had just finished two epic nights with Above & Beyond in Los Angeles. And had flown home right after the second show to run Bay To Breakers.

I was slightly hungry. Slightly.

So you can imagine, that when I got my very well priced slab featuring a wheat tortilla absolutely jammed with grilled tofu, black beans and mild sauce I went to town. It was so amazing.

From the Adrenalin Room (http://youtu.be/HM6pd8-GjGs) to the Adrenalin Burrito.

excerpts: Still love that grilled tofu burrito
, it is very dry and I guess I like that.
grilled tofu.author: D. J.
grilled tofu.review:
Like the place and all the choices of goodies that can be stuffed into a burrito but I am giving it only 2 stars because of the woman (hispanic) at the cash register.  I say hispanic because when I had been there once before I was helped by a caucasian woman who could not have been more welcoming.  This woman yesterday did not acknowledge me at all when I smiled and paid and actually looked away when she shoved my burrito at me, gave me a sour look when I thanked her.  Really bizarre behavior.  I know lots of folks will put up with a lot for good food but for me it is 50% food, 50% atmosphere and service and so I am giving only 2 stars.  We will see how she treats me next time, it might be the last.

Well I have been back twice and the woman has been friendlier . . . actually got her to smile once - maybe you have to get through her process.  So, I'm adding a star, maybe she will work her way up!  Still love that grilled tofu burrito, it is very dry and I guess I like that.

excerpts: The grilled tofu was a nice experience, but the rice and beans were totally dry and flavorless.
Even doused in salsa and lime, the burrito failed to impress.
It may have been a healthy burrito, but when I'm in the mood for a burrito, I'm not in the mood for light and airy--
I'm in the mood for loads of juicy beans, greasy cheese, thick rice, and spicy jalepenos.
grilled tofu.author: lizzie r.
grilled tofu.review: I have to give this place credit for having a lot of options, as far as burritos go. The grilled tofu was a nice experience, but the rice and beans were totally dry and flavorless. Even doused in salsa and lime, the burrito failed to impress. It may have been a healthy burrito, but when I'm in the mood for a burrito, I'm not in the mood for light and airy-- I'm in the mood for loads of juicy beans, greasy cheese, thick rice, and spicy jalepenos.
